text: I'm no seafood aficionado, but this place seemed pretty good to me, and I hope it sticks around because fresh seafood like this (and at these prices) is fairly unusual here in the desert. Our table tried the fish and chips, swordfish, seafood kebab and catfish -- and all were satisfied. As noted in other reviews, the staff is jovial and the atmosphere is pleasant. Whew -- saves me a trip to Boston!

I am rather picky about my seafood and was surprised by some of the negative reviews of this place; so I decided to give it a try. The ambiance inside was a bit cold so we ate outside (pleasant) and the service was excellent. The food did not disappoint. The grilled artichoke and crab cakes were wonderful appetizers and our group ordered the Mahi Mahi, Tilapia and sea bass. All were flavorful, cooked perfectly and included pretty good accompaniments (i.e. fresh spinach, cheesy grits, garlic mashed, etc.). Their menu offers a huge variety including fresh oysters, a nice selection of salads, and lobster. And for the non fish eater, there are sandwiches, chicken, pasta and steaks. They also offer a very nice list of beer and wine. For a restaurant in Arizona that specializes in fish, King's is a pretty good place. I would go again.

Our server was awesome!! Food was lacking flavor. We ordered calamari as our appetizer and it was good, but the sauces were terrible. I ordered the lemon nut crusted sea bass and it had no flavor at all. My husband ordered the scallops blackened, but they were actually just Cajun scallops. Overall the experience was ok, but not worth the price.

Four of us went to dinner here and two of us had to send our cold dinner back. The menu has changed from what it was before. They used to have a better selection and now the food had much to be desired . Too bad...the coconut shrimp they used to have was great.  We won't be going back soon at those prices.   J and K

Stopped by for a couple drinks and dinner with a work friend of mine recently on a Wednesday night.  The place wasn't packed, and we sat inside at the bar.  The mussels were ok, and the salmon sushi roll was better than I expected - considering it's in the desert and a regional chain.  It's in a unique spot in Tempe marketplace, and I knew parking would not be easy, but I didn't care.  I found the service to be very good and helpful.  I would go back.

Hands down the best place for bivalves. I've dropped about about two hundred bucks on oysters there and have never been disappointed with one of them. Sitting at the bar (go figure) I like to start with a Stella and a dozen huge slurpers with some hot sauce. When a few friends show up we move on to the crabcakes and crab legs.  After a few more Stellas and few more friends we do oyster shooters till Lindsey cuts us off. Of the oysters, I mean.  Apparently their labor costs were getting a little out of hand with our group ordering so many. I love this place for the food and the good service. A definite must at the Marketplace.

Great place, for some reason i don't think it is ever really that busy though which i guess is a good thing if you are trying to snag a table quick. The wait staff were really helpful and friendly and knowledgeable on everything they offered up.    The only reason they don't get Five stars is because we ordered the Thresher Shark and they were out, so he offered another dish in place of it, but he pulled a sneaky quick one when the meal we got in place of it was more than double the price of the shark.... lol

We are restaurant connoisseurs...we try all different types of places and have our favorites...mostly seafood fares.   So we were excited to learn of the Kings Fish House and the wonderful menu. We decided to try dinner last Saturday and to make a long story short, we were disappointed.   We rate restaurants for our overall experience, not just the food. And unfortunately, this place delivered neither. Our server, to put it mildly, was very curt and not helpful with understanding the menu. It seemed like we were a bother to him, eating at his station. Awful service. Now to the meals...everything was was over cooked...for a seafood restaurant, you would figure they would know how to cook it...not the case. It was a shame to have over cooked clams, King Crab legs and lobster...chewy, ALL of it. Even the rice was over cooked...really?! Again, too bad...giving this place 1 star for convenience of location....that's it.

Way too expensive for what they give you, and they will get your order wrong.  I had a craving for clam chowder and called around, found out they had it, and placed an order for pick-up. I asked for crackers with my chowder, just to be sure, and they assured me that they'd put that with my order. My husband asked for fish and chips.  When I get there to pick it up and got a look at the receipt I almost fainted. They charged $18 for the fish and chips; the cup of clam chowder was $7 and when I got the bag home and opened it up, it was on the small side for a cup. There were also NO crackers for my clam chowder. The pieces of fish were rather big, but not big enough to warrant spending $18.

Our first visit here was mostly a pleasant experience.  I had the Yellow Tail Tuna, spinach, and rosemary potatoes.  My gf had Fish and Chips.  We shared a bottle of Riesling.  It was very busy on the Saturday night we went, so instead of sitting out the one hour wait we decided on eating at the bar.  The fish was terrific and fresh--I understand it's shipped in same day from Los Angeles.  I felt the "chips" part of the Fish and Chips were kinda lame given the price of the meal.  Also, occasionally a really nasty odor wafted in--I think maybe a sewer smell from outdoors coming in through the open windows.  That only happened a couple of times & I wouldn't expect that to be the general experience for people eating here.  Altogether a good eating experience.

My boyfriend and I have been here a couple of times and we loved it.  I continually ordered the shrimp po'boy and it was great.  There mac and cheese is definiately good!!  We enjoyed this place so much that we decided to bring some friends for dinner because they had never been to this resturant.  Our dinner was expensive and was not worth the money.  I do not mind spending money if the meal is worth it.  I ordered a rare filet with lobster.  The filet was extremely rare, it was as if they left it on the grill just to brown the outsides.  The inside was cold it was so rare.  The lobster was chewy and difficult to eat.  It was later at night so idk if they stopped putting effort in cooking and wanted to get out of work or what.  Our wait staff was very friendly though.  On a good note, there sourdough bread is very good.

We've been here twice and on both occasions the service and food were excellent.  Our server, Chris, was phenomenal and provided us with excellent recommendations for fresh oysters and our entrees.  We ordered the halibut, trout almondine and yellowtail.  We didn't have the tiniest morsel left on our plates.

This was my first experience at King's, and I have to say it was exceptional. Great recommendations from our server Ashley P. The ceviche is perfect, you can tell the fish is very fresh. Grilled Artichoke is wonderful, and we tried the lobster crunchy roll, I'll say their sushi very good, as well. I will definitely be back to try a proper dinner entree.

Great atomosphere, great food, great service. At our table we had the salmon, yellowtail, sand dabs, and scallops. Scallops & Sand dabs were out of this world. We're all on diets so we passed on the big yummy looking load of sourdough bread. (ahhh bread). Our server was cute, he offered to bring us Rye because I told him we were all on diets.  I dont usually get geeked up about salad dressing, but the basil vingeratte was really good! The sand dabs looked more like Patrole sole & had a yummy lemon caper sauce & my scallops were perfect.

Granted with a seafood menu that changes daily, due to availability, it certainly is a fine find for Phoenix.  However we had some mixed reviews.  We both had the spicy seafood chowder.  It was extremely good with plenty of seafood, had a nice favorful taste but not necessarily "spicy", but that's our taste and we would most definitely order it again.  Just don't be put off by the "spicy" label.  The bread is awesome.  I had the Ahi tuna and my partner had the whaoo.  Perhaps it was simply an off day but the tuna they served me was full of membrane (grizzle).  Out waiter saw the piece after he served it and was very quick to remove and replace it.  The sauce that accompanied it was tasteless and couldn't figure out what it was or suppose to be.  I had to request wasabi which typically always comes with ahi. The garlic mashed potato's were a garlic lovers dream.  Now to the wahoo.  We were surprised to see it offered in the desert as we always order it when on the Yucatan.  If you haven't had the pleasure it is a firm white fish with a distinct taste.  Unfortunately, this piece was overcooked and thus dry.    So perhaps an off day for the kitchen and with that much fresh fish combined with the length of time they have been in operation, we will definitely give it another try.

My family and I had a wonderful dining experience. The food was very tasty and fresh. The waitstaff/ manager were very friendly and informative. The oysters were AWESOME!!!! The prices were fare. I will definitely return!!

We are all the way from Reno, and they have great food they have there seafood delivered every couple days and they print there menu twice daily and thats how fresh there food is depending on what is they het shipped is that's on the menu, they have great service we had Jeremy and Stephen (the gray haired kid) as our server, they we're implacable they gave wonderful service and very knowledgeable on how, when, and where there food is coming from and how it's prepared.
Exceptional food and service! Good good good amazing. Like sugar and spice and everything nice Yum Yum Yum Yum Yum Yum Yum Yum

Why is this Kings still open ? I have being going to kings for 4/5 years and the only reason I keep going back is because I always forget how bad it is .  the food sucks  the service sucks  the management sucks   Hey Mr King shut her down ! Your staff don't care and your hemorrhaging money . Cut your losses and call it a day .

We came here for our wedding anniversary last Fall and were very disappointed. My parents love this place in Southern CA, so they recommended we eat here in Tempe. The waiter didn't seem to know much about the menu and wasn't able to offer really good advice. He just would say everything was "really good." He also seemed to take occasional smoke breaks, because he would come back to our table wreaking of cigarettes and stink up the whole area. It was extremely unappetizing to smell that odor throughout our dinner. Every time he'd come back to the table, the smell of like wet musty cigs just kind of lingered in the air and my husband and I would look at each other. In addition to that, the food was bland. I ordered steamed mussels and they really didn't offer any kind of good broth. I also ordered a white fish off their most popular menu thinking that I couldn't go wrong and it was completely bland. My husband thought his meal was decent. We both agreed we would never go back to King's Fish House when we want to eat a nice seafood meal.

I got into a seafood kick and convinced a coworker to tag along. There doesn't seem to be a whole lot of non fast-food seafood places in Tempe. Google Maps pointed out King's Fish House.  The menu looks amazing. However lunch during the work week isn't the time to crack shells or have a food coma over an over indulgence. I had fried oysters on the brain and seriously considered several of the 7 or so different raw oysters (the Tempe menu is a little different from the one online).  We started with the fried oyster appetizer. The 5-6 pieces were lightly deep fried and were really oily. The breading didn't have a chance to stay on for very long but the oysters themselves were very tasty. The cocktail sauce was light and the tartar sauce was average. The spicy garlic sauce in a bottle at the table added a little nice kick.  Coworker ordered the skewered scallops and shrimp. They were overcooked. A scallop was cut in half with a fork and it sprung back into place like rubber. The shrimp was dry even with half the shell still on it. The blackened 5-6oz Atlantic salmon (Farmed Cypress Island Salmon) was half good and half very dry and overcooked. A few minutes after ordering, I had a feeling I should have ordered the swordfish. However it was seasoned well, was tasty and had a nice charred flavor to it. The grilled zucchini was very good. But again only half of the very unevenly sliced pieces were grilled - the ungrilled pieces were a bit undercooked (not really that big of a deal) and seemed to have missed all of the seasoning, too. The creamy-looking garlic mashed potatoes looked as if they were plain but had the perfect amount of garlic flavor to it.  There was a little bit of a wait between drinks/appetizer and the main dishes but the service was very good and our server was very attentive. The restaurant is spacious with high ceilings and gave it a roomy feeling.  I've noticed that this place seems to be evenly hit and miss with Yelpers (+grain of salt). The oyster selection will bring me back for another go but having all of our main dishes overcooked was really disappointing.

The staff was very nice but the the food was disappointing. My husband ordered fish and chips and I ordered the fried shrimp. 3 of my shrimp tasted pretty good but the last 3 pieces smelled and tasted very fishy, almost like they were unclean. Couldn't finish it. Also got the Mac and cheese for a side and some of the noodles were undercooked but overall has a decent taste. My husbands fish was disgusting. So greasy and soggy and also had a strange unclean fish smell and taste. His side of fries were good though but unfortunately he couldn't even finish his $18 plate. So unless you plan on just eating sides for dinner I'd stay clear of fried fish and shrimp. Here's hoping neither one of us gets sick. Definitely will not be going back.

Thank god i had a gift certificate with this dump! Food was bland,.no taste, salad was small, for the price, nothing special about this place,.generic facade of a seafood place,.dont waste your money!!

If you live near fresh water (San Francisco, Seattle) don't eat fish here. Everything - EVERYTHING is frozen. Sand dab, no, - scallops - no, prawns eh, no- even frying it didn't help. just don't eat fish in AZ.  Veggies are good  Wait staff is good Mojito was GREAT - not a mix
I had an amazing experience at Kings Fish House. The food is awesome but the service from Mike Smiley is what keeps me coming back. He is awesome!

My boyfriend and I came here last night for a belated birthday dinner and I felt like we made a good choice. Our server, Katelyn, was fantastic. I had multiple questions about the menu and she answered every question with a smile and gave us some great recommendations. We started with the grilled artichoke which was messy and delicious and exactly how I like my food. I ordered the swordfish tacos and loved how colorful they were. These were a little messy as well but delicious. My boyfriend ordered the sea scallops with carrots and spinach as his sides. He cleared his plate. We took a look at the dessert menu but decided we were too full to have dessert. We will definitely be back.

Service was decent, fish was dry and not very tasty. $100 for a couple definitely not worth it , fish and chips were mainly all batter and dripping with oil . Contacted us within a week sent us a $50 gift card haven't used it yet but will give this place a second chance for sure ,,,,,moving them up a star for that....

On our first trip to Tempe Marketplace we decided to dine at King's Fish House as me and my wife rarely get to eat fish with an 8 year old in tow, but their kids menu seemed adequate, so we decided to say.  We started with the Clam Chowder which was flavorful, but the portion was small, which turned out to be a theme throughout the night.  My wife and I split the Blackened Mahi Mahi with Mango salsa along with Jasmine rice and Glazed carrots. I won't argue with the price of a good meal, but our portions were really small for the price. The rice had only a hit of Jasmine, and the carrots were underdone. The fish was very good, but again I was put off by the portion size.  For dessert we had Strawberry Shortcake, and while the "cake" was good, size was again a problem as the shortcake wasn't much larger than a half-dollar.  Our waiter was inattentive as we had to ask for drinks and bread several times, and he didn't seem very knowledgeable about the menu.  Overall the food was good, but there was nothing special about the experience at all, and there is not much value based on the portion size. I would not recommend this restaurant.
Food was great. Service was great. Brittany did an awesome job... Definitely coming back.

This is the best oyster bar in AZ....Kaylin our server was very knowledgeable about the food and had a great attitude. Ashley the manager was amazing as well. Our first time dining experience was fantastic, food was top notch. We will definitely be back... a must try

On this Friday night we found it to be busy with a 20 minute wait but it was well worth it. This place is the best seafood place around. Great huge menu, friendly staff. Delicous food!  Husband had the Fish and Chips which he said was exceptional and I had Linguini with Clams, which I have to say was the best meal I've had in ages. Just perfect. Can't wait to return!
Hi worst New Years Meal ever, slow service , remake drink3 times, rude manager, incorrect check.

Okay, I'm fron Orange County, California and seafood is a staple for me. King's was a definite go to restaurant even when I lived close to the coast. It simply cannot be beat. Now imagine that freshness and quality in the middle of a desert at a place that only uses their freezer for ice cream.... Yeah, super fresh and super tasty. We started with the dozen sampler of oysters which was phenomenal. We then had the house salad and the AMAZING sourdough bread and butter. Let me just tell you, I could have had the bread, salad, and oysters and called it a day and been happy. For the main course my girlfriend had the filet and lobster tail and I had the linguini with clams. You simply cannot do better than this. King's is the King. The staff is super polite, friendly, and speedy. The general manager even came out to make sure we were doing well. Best place to go for a high quality meal that will never let you down!!!

Dined here on Wednesday (1/22/2014) with my daughter for dinner.  Service was very good but our waiter was not up to speed on their menu or seafood.  Daughter had the sea bass that was not fresh but should have been for the price. My sea scallops were not sea scallops but appeared to be small bay scallops and were definitely frozen and chewy.  Will write this place off the list as a good place to eat.

I had dinner and drinks there tonight with friends. I had the ahi tuna which was very good and everyone seemed to enjoy their meals as well. The cosmopolitans were fabulous. The only downside was that they had the bar window wide open and it was freezing in the restaurant tonight.  $100 for the 3 off us.

Our server was Jeremy. He was just terrific! He made sure our meal flowed in a way that everything was the right temperature and was so enjoyable because of it. Great food with amazing service.. You have to try it!!!
Food was great, service was fast & the atmosphere was nice. We are surely enjoyed our first time here.  I recommend trying the HOT n' SPICY POKE TUNA !! so BOMB !!

Large group - been here since about 7. Food finally coming out after 9:00. Amazingly, there was only 1 server for about 25 people. Maybe it will get better now that they've closed!  Let's see if any of the staff stick around for this group.  From what I've seen, I doubt it. I won't be back.

I had dinner at Kings Fish House tonight with my family. The food was amazing and our service was outstanding. Our waiter, Brian, was excellent, very attentive and had great recommendations for us. It is apparent that he is very knowledgeable about seafood and the immense options at Kings. We enjoyed the overall experience and will definitely be returning.
Had the Mahi Mahi with spinach and carrots.  Their southwest salad is incredible. Corn, tortilla chips, beans with a chipotle based dressing was a meal by itself.
Excellent meal, wonderful service. Our waiter Andrew is the best!! We especially love the Chipotle ranch dressing and the shrimp taquitos.  Next time we promise to get dessert!

My hubby and I came here for lunch. I had the salmon salad and it was delicious! The service was quick and waiter was very nice and never let our drinks reach the bottom. Once you sit down they bring a sourdough bread which is delicious and dangerous if your watching your bread intake! The only thing I would point out is that there are two entrances one is for the bar and the other the main entrance. We walked in through the oyster bar entrance which wasn't bad it's just that when we did this we had to walk through the restaurant to get to the hostess. Other than that this place knows it's seafood!

I came here today with my mom for our mother-daughter shopping day. I saw the prices and kind of freaked. Not gonna lie, I was a little worried. I ordered the lemon nut sea bass with the Mac n cheese and garlic mashed potatoes. My mom got the clam linguine. We both fell in love. The Mac and cheese... I can't even describe it. It was amazing. Even my mom was blown away. We left there with full tummies, and a little buzzed. Would definitely come back. Maybe I'll bring the boyfriend here soon. Either way, I'm getting the sea bass.

Ordered a large sushi platter. Worst sushi my Fiancé and I have ever had. Tasted old and was not fresh at all. Almost as if they thawed frozen fish to make the rolls. Also ridiculously over priced menu for farmed fish. Can't speak for other items on the menu as this was our first time here. Service was good.
Great food on a perfect day to sit outside at the bar with outstanding service from Amanda! We'll be back!!

I drove by this place a bunch of times going to Tempe Marketplace and from the outside it looked like a cool place that was worth a try. I went with a work group and we got crab cakes and calamari as an appetizer that were decent. I ordered the trout, which was just okay, it was quite plain tasting, not much flavor. I can't really say too much good about this place, its nothing special, it acts like a step up from Red Lobster, but its really not. At least Red Lobster has great smoothies and cheddary biscuits.
Wasn't very impressed with the food. Service mediocre. My sister had the tuna very bland they didn't give me the right side dish. For the price I think we will find a different place for fish.

I was taken to King's Fish House for my birthday by my wife and daughter.  We were wanting to try a place we had not been before.  Since we live in NW Glendale we were hoping King's would be better than average.  It was.  Oysters were great... not too fishy and a great assortment of sides with it.  Even tried some tuna sushi.  Courses went from scallops to macadamia crusted halibut to N'awlins shrimp.  5 drinks between us and a couple appetizers as well as a couple of deserts.  We requested to be seated outside (it was really nice outside) but no one was out there and it was a Wednesday night... makings for disastrous wait staff problems.  But we had a great waiter who came just the perfect amount of times even though we were "out of the way".  So... It's a 30 mile trek for us... and we won't go back all the time but we will go back when we want a great seafood restaurant!

The fish tacos were delish.   The lobster bisque was awful.   It had a poor after taste, too sweet, and was missing any noticeable lobster.  We splurged on the diets with the sourdough bread and while I feel guilty on one hand the other was happy because the bread was yummy.

Perfect Sunday lunch.  That's not a bad way to start a review I think.  We went here last Sunday right before going to the movies.  We ordered the Cold Seafood Combo; it was crab legs, peel-n-eat shrimp, clams and oysters. Plenty of food for 2 people.  It was a really slow there but that's fine by me.  The beer was very good and cold. For the meal for 2, plus we each had 2 beers...it was only about $50.   We spoke to the manager and he gave us a coupon for next months Lobsterfest, buy one lobster get one free.  So of course we'll be back.

Surprisingly decent variety and quality of seafood for a chain restaurant. I've had several business lunches here and it hit the mark. The service tends to be substandard similar to what you'd expect from a chili's waiter making near the poverty line and being forced to wear an obnoxious amount of flair.

King's is a great experience.  The food is fresh, well prepared, comes in a good portion size, and is served by attentive staff.  I even enjoy the decor of the restaurant; it fits the bill quite well.  I'm not saying it's the best fish house ever, but considering the somewhat reasonable prices, it's a safe bet.
Freshest fish around and friendly staff too.  I worked for these guys many moons ago and can tell you they defintely go out of their way to serve the freshest seafood you'll find.

I've tried several times to eat oysters and it has ended poorly each time. My dad is a huge fan and he prefers to fry them. Still, I'd heard that some people eat them raw and have wanted to try them that way for a while. It was an adventure for both of us, but my dad and I shared an order of raw oysters. That is some of the best food the sea has to offer.  In addition to the oysters of which we ordered another plate, I also tried the clam chowder and loved that as well. This place is pretty pricey, but good seafood in Arizona is hard to come by. I will return for another plate of raw oysters as soon as I can.

I had grilled Mexican (Baja California) Yellowfin Tuna (rare) with garlic sauteed spinach and grilled zucchini. Very Good!!  Great setting, service was good.    I others in my party really liked theirs too, they had halibut.

This place is not worth the price. I ordered the shrimp louie salad entree which lacked any flavor at all. I expected that I would get nice large shrimp only it was a pile of tiny cold, boring shrimp on top of a plate full of lettuce with large hunks of unseasoned raw veggies. I took a few bites and then just stopped eating it. I am a person that loves salads, they can be made healthy and flavorful when done well, but this one is something I could have thrown together at home myself. When our server saw my salad not eaten, he simply asked if I was finished but didn't even ask if I enjoyed it. Clearly I did not enjoy it since I took only 3 or 4 bites.  My boyfriend ordered the smoked salmon tortellini which actually tasted fine, however the price was high and there was only a small amount of salmon in the dish. It was more of a pasta with cream sauce and a little bit of salmon thrown in for flavor. We each had one drink from the bar and the bill came to $50.00.  The best thing here was the sourdough bread, however I expected them to ask if we wanted more bread after we finished the first piece on our table and they did not ask if we wanted more. Personally I don't mind not getting more bread because I don't like to overeat it, however I think they should at least ask if we would like more. Overall, the food was so-so but the main thing is that the prices were shockingly high for the quality of the food we received. In my opinion the food, atmosphere, and service was not worth it.
Just ate there. Had an awesone meal. Sat on patio and enjoyed the beautiful weather. LEVI WAS A SUPERB WAITPERSON. He was informed about the menu and made great recommendations. Will go back soon.

We came here for dinner recently.  It was a horrible hot day. So I wanted to go out after being out of town all week. We went in the bar entrance. The bartender sat us in the restaurant ,but where he could see us in the bar. He was our waiter,which was fine until he got busy. M's Fish dinner had to be sent back because it was just not that good and incredibly salty. They did make him another one which came out much better. It was not the worst fish I have ever had, but not the best either.  Maybe because, it is Phoenix and I am comparing it with other cities. But, sad to say I am not a fan. However, the corn was really good. I am not a corn eater normally, but it was cut fresh off the corn and was really good.  The reason I am giving 5 stars is the dessert. It was such good Key lime Pie! I mean really good. They say they make it right there in the restaurant! It tasted just like what I had in The Keys! Who would ever think that you would go for fish and love the dessert instead, but it happened. This is a place I would go to in the future for dessert for sure, the seafood is better than Red Lobster, but that is not saying much. Because, I cannot say I would ever go to a Red Lobster ever again. I might go back here though. Maybe we just need to give it another try.   I thought the cocktail napkins were really cute. The menus are printed up every day so that would indicate they maybe just had a bad fish day. Bathrooms were clean and the parking is easy.

King's Fish House is the incarnation of "average" in my book.  I ended up here for lunch with a handful of co-workers last week because we put the lunch option up to a vote, and this was the compromise spot.  This place isn't great, but it isn't horrible.  I'd never come here again of my own volition, but if I ended up here for some reason beyond my control, I'd find something on the menu that wouldn't suck.  As far as chain fish joints in Phoenix go, this is not nearly as good as say ... Kincaid's ... but it's far better than Joe's Crab Shack.  And that, in a nutshell, is why I give this place three stars.

We had dinner here for my birthday, there was about 15 of us. The food was great, service was great, and the prices not so great... I guess that comes along with great food and seafood! I recommend this place, at least to try it. We went on a Sunday evening and it wasn't busy at all.

Had a great experience here last night. The cedar plank salmon was wonderful. Had a chance to taste the halibut, one encrusted in hazel nut and one simply grilled, both were top notch. Add to all this fine food, a fantastic server, Ash and you have a great night out. As a visitor to Temper Arizona, I was pleasantly surprised to find such a good  seafood restaurant.

I was there 2 days ago for 630 dinner on a Friday. Tempe Market very busy because of Xmas shopping. I had a crab Louie salad and a local beer on tap. Others ordered the Ono and crab cakes and rock fish. Dishes were nicely made. Fish tasted fresh. Could actually carry on a conversation, which I always greatly value.

Thank you Gilbert for making my ASU grad celebration extra especial. Your recommendations were divine. And that "Hooked on Butter Cake" was delectable!!!! The oyster sampler was such a treat. Thank you.

Had New Years Day dinner here today with friends and had a great time!! We started with 2 dozen oysters for our appetizers and they were very fresh, which for Arizona is rare.  Our dinners were very good and we sampled 3 desserts- our favorite was the warm butter cake with cold ice cream which was suggested by our awesome waiter Gilbert.  If you eat here- ask for him- he is sarcastically funny and made our evening with his witty personality.  The manager Ashley was very sweet and checked in our table personally several times.  We give them an A+ and made reservations already for a second visit!! Thanks Gilbert and Ashley!

Best Lobster Bisque In the world. Got here about 845 pm and were greeted by some very friendly staff - the two bartenders, the great hostess and our awesome waitress Jen. The blackened salmon was spiced and done just perfect and my 2 sides of the sautéed veggies and zucchini were outstanding. Jen was great and checked in on our party frequently and was very attentive and quick. Got me extra lemons and I was just a happy camper. Had no idea there was an extraordinary seafood restaurant right here in Tempe. Love Pappadeux up off the I-17 and Peoria Ave and now have one on this side of town. Nice comfortable and classy atmosphere and feel. Be back soon.

Almost any place that has Stone Pale Ale can get 4 stars with me...  I've started taking visitors here regularly, especially if they want fish.  They print their menus new every day to reflect the fresh fish.  The garlic roasted asparagus appetizer is the best I've ever had.  Sometimes, I just want this for lunch all to myself.  I keep experimenting with the fish, and I've been both pleased and disappointed.  Had dry Thresher Shark once, and I don't really like their blackening seasoning.  And their side items suck.  But if you're looking some good fish or oysters, and hate side items, check it out...

Best place for oysters in Phoenix!  There are always several varieties from the Pacific Northwest, often some from British Colombia, and the eastern seaboard as well.  Our visit tonight was made more enjoyable by our server, Gilbert.  Attentive and also very pleasant and enjoyable.  Personable!  Like he enjoyed his job and likes people! I will look for him next time we come in.

Bottom line:  Food great--server must have been new or over stressed.  Place was noisy.  We were one of three large groups all seated in the same area, which increased the noise level.   We were a group of 8 -- arriving 10 minutes apart. 2nd  group arrived just as 1st group were getting water which was then given to second group arriving.  One member of first group waited a good 15 minutes to get water and had to ask a couple of times with a dismayed response on part of server that guest would want water.   Drinks took forever .  Server apologized that bar was busy though  we could see no one in the bar.   Food came quickly, was hot and as requested.  4 beet salads were fantastic but they are large.  All servings are large.  Most in the group opted for a only one or two appetizers which were more than adequate as an entree.   A couple of full meals in the group which were beautifully done and excellent quality.  Shared desert of creme brulee was excellent.   We will go back but hope the service has improved a whole lot.

My husband and I love seafood! we had been wanting to check this place out....we finally did and were really dissapointed! totally overpriced! We had a bowl of clam chowder to start off and it had maybe one clam in it and super salty. We decided to go with the cold sea food plate(not sure what its called) the description said for 2 or more ppl. They made it sound like a very large plate with shrimp, crab, oysters and clams ($27).finally got our food and were surprised to see a big plate full of ice! Only 4oysters 4shrimp 4 small clams and 3very small crab legs! This was not even enough as an appetizer for 1 person! Our server was very distracted, even though it wasnt busy at all. deff wont be coming back to waste money on something that is not worth it at all.

This was my 2nd time to this restaurant and will be our last. Our waiter Cody spent more time "chatting" with his fellow co-workers. Salad was late and only brought when we asked about it. Iceberg lettuce for $4.95! Food was immediately brought after salad. Food was luke warm. Ordered scallops and paid $25.00 for them. 8 1" fishy tasting. Worst scallops ever, especially for the price. We ordered a bottle of wine and Cody put in a bucket at the end of our table. Not once did he come back and pour for us. Very sub-par for the money. Won't return!

Decided to try this place tonight on a whim. We walked through the first open door we saw, which ended up being the bar. Once we finally walked in the right door we were sat immediately.   My hubby ordered the barbecue shrimp and clam chowder. I had the seafood Cobb. All of our food was great, especially the bbq shrimp. We will definitely order it again.   Service was decent and the ambience was good also. We will definitely go back again.

I had read a review that King's was an over priced Red Lobster. Unfortunately the food didn't even measure up to that. Over cooked fishy tasting salmon that wasn't fresh, soft shell crab was horrible, and for the price point we were expecting much more.

Great oysters and clam chowder. It's on the pricier side but worth it. Good place to go with friends or a date. But the con is wouldn't recommend to go alone. They don't really play attention to you if you are alone.

Went in for the first time and I must say I am FIVE star impressed. Went in alone and sat at the bar and a delightful gentleman named Chris G helped me. Since I wasn't familiar with the menu, he suggested a bunch of different options. Went with a sushi roll which was delicious. I was hankering for something else light, and Chris recommended the grilled zucchini. BEST decision ever! Soooo good. I sincerely appreciate Chris and his great personality and way he guided me through the experience. And the menu, yes please! I'll definitely be back, especially to see Chris! Thank you thank you!!

I visited this restaurant with a colleague of mine for lunch.  I had the wild jumbo shrimp pasta dish.  The shrimp were not completely shelled, and so I had to pick the shells off.  The tomato sauce used in this dish was watery thin.  My colleague asked for no cheese of any kind on his fish tacos but he still got cheese.  So he just picked it off.  Our waiter was not the most attentive person.  A manager never stopped by to ask how things were.  There are definitely better places to eat at Tempe Market Place.  I seriously doubt I will ever return here.

Me and my boyfriend decided to come here and try this restaurant out for the first time. We were greeted immediately and had a table outside in no time. We had a great server who admitted she was training but she was bubbly and answered all of our questions. When her shift ended we had another server named Steven that was always on top of everything. He consistently brought bread and drinks without ya ever having to ask, and brought our food out in minutes and consistently checked on us to make sure we were doing okay. The management of this restaurant should be very proud of their employees and how hard they work. The food was amazing and we left extremely happy. I would recommend this to everyone.

I was extremely excited to try this place since I love sea food. I went with my boyfriend and his mom. All 3 of us felt that our food was just not good. It tasted funky and service was mediocre. After eating my tilapia, I headed home and felt immediately sick. Long story short, I had the worst food poisoning ever! Will not be returning..

My wife and I loved this place!  The menu was outstanding - thoroughly impressed with the wide variety.  I had the New England Clam Bake - delicious lobster, clams and mussels... the clam chowder was delicious as well.  My wife had the ono, which she thoroughly enjoyed, too.  Highly recommend the oyster sampler as an appetizer.  We took home some bread pudding for a late night dessert too.  Service was great, lots of good recommendations from our waitress.  We went to Wildfish near Fashion Square not long ago, and I'd have to say we'd return to King's way before going back to Wildfish.  Much more reasonable, price-wise, as well.  No complaints - they made a great first impression on us!

I had the best experience tonight at king's! Ashley was my server and she helped me choose what to eat, I had the hazelnut salmon she recommended and it was delicious! Finger licking good! Will be back soon!!

Finding a FRESH Seafood Restaurant in Arizona can almost always be a chore so we were delighted when they presented us with a menu printed daily with a great selection of fish - shellfish etc.  We immediately got the party started with a selection of several oyster types harvested from Canada to Mexico and were amazed when they arrived super fresh and prepared correctly.  Very uncommon to get them so fresh without grit or shell pieces.  Without doubt the best we've have had in Arizona.  Im a Clam Chowder fanatic and I cant believe I'm saying this but this place had the best of anything I've tasted on either coast.  The chowder was filled with fresh clams not chunks of potato filler much appreciated!  Seems like we ordered one of everything and all of it was fantastic never experience a fishy smell or taste the entire meal the way fresh fish should be.  Nice atmosphere and a cool little pub area makes this place my favorite Fish House.  Prices are fair for this type of meal possibly a little steep for the Tempe Mall I would imagine they could triple their ROI with a location in North Scottsdale hint hint.  Anyway this place is well worth the 30 minute trip from our home and we will be back again soon.  Forgot to mention they have great craft packets to keep the kids busy at the table better than any other restaurant - our six and eight year old girls loved it.

Came last Friday night for my birthday.  Had drinks, apps, dinner and dessert.  I got there a little early so was able to find open seating in the bar area (which was a nice sized booth that comfortably fit four) and the waiter/bartender was very nice.  We had wine and beer, then ordered two types of oysters on the half shell.  They were INCREDIBLE!  I had not had them before so I wasn't sure how I would like it, but I LOVED them.  At the recommendation of the server, we got the Kumamota and the Black Duck Salts.  Served w fresh horseradish, cocktail sauce, a white wine sauce, and a new mango habanero (DELISH) and they were OUTstanding.  Also had the edamame (salted) which was good.    For dinner we tried: blackened swordfish, Parmesan crusted ono, grilled ono, and fish and chips which the waitress said were the best she has ever had.  They were good, it was all good!!  I highly recommend the Parmesan crusted ono and the blackened swordfish!!  The Brussels sprouts are good, too!!    We finished off w a shared Jack Daniels Bread Pudding.  I would go back weekly just for the oysters and the bread pudding!!  (Okay, and the Wine of course)   Try it out if you're in the Tempe Marketplace area

It is too bad that this location is so far way from home. I have been to several King's Fish House both in AZ and in CA. And have always been very happy.   I am not a fan of the Tempe Market Place area. It is a little difficult to get in and out of.  But I do like the setting.  We were able to sit outdoors and watch people go by which was enjoyable.   We had Salmon for both orders. Very well prepared. Just a nice piece of fish well cooked.   Service was very good.  This is always a go to if we are in the area for a nice piece of fish.

Let me start off by saying I really don't like seafood... so I'm not very qualified to review this place. However, my friend invited some of us to stop by here Friday to celebrate her just-received and hard-earned master's degree from ASU. So I went. We ate in the oyster bar area. The place is really cute. Sure, it looks kind of corporate, but in a nice way. It's definitely the kind of place I would want to stop by for drinks with my friends. The wine list was OK, and they had some nice sake and martinis. Our waitress was great and really friendly.  The seafood platter they ordered smelled good.. and everyone who ate it said it was tasty. It's definitely a bit pricey, but if the seafood is really that fresh, I guess it's worth it.  I'll probably bring my parents here when they visit and then I'll try something off the menu. The choices (aside from the sushi and seafood platters) range from pricey things like $20+  for the trout or the macadamia-nut crusted halibut to $12 tuna melts.  In the meantime, I have a good opinion of this place. Oh, and it's actually in the parking lot area of Tempe Marketplace, not in that annoying pedestrian part dubbed "The District." So that earns it some points, too.

The only reason I don't give them a single star is because I'm hoping one day they get back to form. My family has been going to the Salt Cellar for many many years and this place stole our business. They always made amazing seafood, fish, and believe it or not had the best wings hands down! Now its just not the same. I heard they switched or lost their main chef, I don't know if thats true. But I bragged this place up for years and finally got my entire girlfriends family to try it as they're big seafood fans. Absolutely terrible the last couple viists. Nobody finished their plate. The staff is still excellent and extremely knowledable about the menu. The cook needs to go! I feel bad because I know it hurts their tips. To say the least after paying for the whole meal and about $200+ later I was upset and won't be back. Salt Cellar is a farther drive but if I'm dropping that much money in a restaurant I want my money's worth.

I came here for lunch with my girlfriends on a weekday. Our food took 45 minutes to come out which seems a little long, especially when you're there for your short work lunch break. I think our waitress was new as she just seemed confused and took forever to get us our checks. Nonetheless, the food was decent but not amazing - maybe mediocre? It's not any kind of stand out of a restaurant in which I'd look forward to it or return to it. Just...blah.
I ate their sushi on 3/22 and found that it was fresh. Service was pleasant and not hurried.

We try to come here on every vist to AZ. I like this location way better than the one in Long Beach. And I live in Long Beach and used to work at that location. LOL. The service was prompt and friendly. The server asked if we would like the kid's food with the appetizers which is always nice. He answered all of our questions and gave suggestions. The food was hot and tasty. Everyone enjoyed their meals. We had a good time.

I had the live Maine lobster, she had the Mahi Mahi.  Lobster not bad (though not the best), and the Mahi Mahi was a little overcooked and dry.  Nothing terrible, and - unfortunately - just what you'd expect at an upscale "Mall-oriented / Chain" operation.  Overall, the place is OK but I doubt we'll be back.

My dad was in town and he is an east coaster so he is very obsessed and picky about his seafood. Our server, Cassie, was amazing and answered my dads million and one questions. Our food was delicious and my dad didn't have one complaint (which is rare)

It's rare that I take the time to write a review but my experience here was so bad I felt compelled to alert anyone who is considering dining here.   My husband and I had a night out and were looking forward to good food and conversation-we had spotted this seafood restaurant and thought we would give it a try. We went in and immediately it was clear that we just seated ourselves. Then a friendly waiter came by and took our drink order. However, it was at least 15 minutes until the drinks returned.   Looking over the menu, we quickly realized that it was more expensive than anticipated (most dishes running between $15.00-30.00) But we rationalized that it's worth paying the difference for quality seafood. So, we placed our orders.  When the food came out and we glimpsed the plates-immediately we were concerned. The presentation was awful and the portions small. My meal consisted of overcooked Talipia, with a small, sad pile of potatoes and coleslaw. I don't consider myself much of a cook but I can tell you that I've made far better fish and potatoes at home. My husband took one bite of his shrimp and pushed the plate away. His shrrimp, also overcooked, was completely unappealing and repulsive.   We discussed the situation and both decided the last thing we wanted to do was spend roughly $70.00 on a horrible meal. We agreed that we'd had far better at Red Lobster. The price rivaled one of my favorite seafood restaurants The Chart House (where I can guarantee you, you won't be disappointed).   We flagged the waiter and asked him to remove the meals from our ticket and that we'd go elsewhere for dinner. Something my husband and I had never, ever done before.   The one good thing I can say, is that both the waiter (and the Manager who came by) were very apologetic and accomodating. They were the one bright spot in a truly awful experience.

Out of my desperation for needing a seafood fix in Tempe one night, the boyfriend and I went to King's. It was a brand I was familiar with so I thought it would be good...the result? Very over-priced, over-cooked, bland seafood. Fish and chips were not nearly as good as George and Dragon, the shrimp was rubbery, and the clam chowder tasted like it was from a can. The only good thing about the meal was the complimentary sourdough bread and the servers were very nice and friendly. Not impressed.

I go to Tempe about once every five years. It's just not convenient for me and, other than ASU, there's nothing there that I can't find closer to home.  On the way home from an awesome car show at Falcon Field in Mesa my wife wanted to pop into Tempe Marketplace. It was lunchtime so we stopped in at King's.  The service was terrific. The ambiance is great and the New Orleans jazz is easy on the ear. But, I came here to eat and I wasn't disappointed.  I had rainbow trout with a side of rice and corn on the cob (which they cut off the cob). My wife had Mexican shrimp on a skewer with a mixed veggie side and rosemary potatoes. Both dishes were excellent.   I may have to come to Tempe more often.

I seriously considered giving King's Fish House 1 star, but our waitress was helpful and tried to accommodate us as best they could.  However, my oysters on the half shell were small and served with some weird shaved horseradish, my steamed shrimp was rather boring, and my wife disliked her fish so much that she couldn't finish it and asked for it to be sent back.  She said it was over-cooked and flavorless.  To be fair to the staff, the waitress and chef both came out to our table and offered to re-cook the fish or make something else entirely for her, but by then, my wife was too turned off to have anything else.  I would never try King's Fish House again.  For a guy originally from Maryland who's had some pretty amazing seafood, there was just too much wrong here to be given a second chance.  For what it's worth, my brother-in-law had the New England clam chowder that night with us and said it was the best he had ever had.

I love this place. I have been going to it since it first open. I had my first oyster there and love them.  Great service and great food! Huge menu that includes a sushi. They serve sough dough bread while you wait for your order. The have huge booths. They have great take home kid cups and a very nice kids menu that even comes with tattoos. The house wine is also pretty good. I highly recommend it.

My mom came to my side of town for us to have lunch and proclaimed she wanted lobster bisque. We both searched via our tech routes, her on her GPS, me on my phone via Yelp and I found this place first.   The reviews seemed to be mixed but Mom was paying so if she wanted lobster bisque, I was going to appease her.   The place looked dead from the outside and hardly any cars in the lot behind the restaurant didn't bode well. But they were open and just in the lull between lunch and dinner.   Mom got her lobster bisque and I decided to give it a whirl too. It was quite tasty and I didn't find it bland at all, unlike what one of the Yelpers said. I found it to have a nice little kick and loved the large chunks of lobster that are usually lacking at other places I've tried it.   Sourdough bread was served with our bisque and it was a very good sourdough.   Our server, Ismael, was very helpful with the large menu. About the only fault I could find with the service is that he seemed to be in a rush to leave the table while my mom was still talking to him. Granted, she was rambling a little about things not related to the menu but it was still a bit rude. The place wasn't busy so I don't think he had to rush off to help another table. I'm going to chalk this up to possible inexperience since Ismael's name tag was handwritten so maybe he was new?   We both decided to try a po' boy sandwich. The menu lists a shrimp po' boy but says to ask your server about other po' boys. We did ask and decided to try the oysters. The oysters in the sandwich were so tender and delicious. The sandwich came with fries and coleslaw. The fries were hot, thin and yummy. Coleslaw isn't my favorite but I didn't think to ask for something else. The sandwich had coleslaw inside too and that was okay but on its own I wasn't a fan.   Dessert was creme brulee, as usual. It was great with a large, sweet strawberry on top.   Going to take my fiance to try the oyster bar. Can't wait!

This place is "aight".  It's not a fancy seafood place, but its not Long John Silver's either.  I actually found it to be a bit pricey for the type of fare, even though understandably seafood tends to be more expensive.  I felt like they were charging more just because they could, but not because they deserved it.  I've had dinner here and a few happy hour events.  Everytime I leave like I enjoyed the food, but was slightly ripped off.  If I were to recommend something:  The calamari and fish tacos were good.

Well.....strike two for you! After my last bad experience at this restaurant, I was immediately contacted by management. They were very apologetic and assured me that what had happened was not their policy. They followed up with sending me a $50.00 gift card, which was not necessary, but an appreciated good gesture. I gave them another try on January 24, 2018 at about 3pm to be sure to get Happy Hour prices. Well, if you can believe it? It was again a disaster! The first bill brought to me, over charged me by $20.00! I was billed for a premium wine that I did not order @ $12.00 per glass (my wine was $5.50 per glass). I asked the bartender if the wine was not on Happy Hour? He said no, but then admitted he had incorrectly charged me for a different wine. Yes, he was apologetic and corrected that error. Next, I gave him the gift  card that I had been given to pay for my bill. You guessed it!, It was no good!!! I was told by the manager that he could comp my charges ($34.38) but could not give me the remaining balance?! He suggested that I pay for this meal, and he would activate me a new card?! Well in the end he was unable to activate a new card but returned my invalid card w a note stating it was worth $50.00??? I am extremely grateful that I did not have a guest with me as it would have been even more embarrassing.  While I must say they were polite and apologetic, I can't help but wonder what's going on?? Do they pad these bar bills hoping most will just overlook it? Do they not have a petty cash fund to cover such mishaps? To ask a previously dissatisfied customer to pay them again for poor practices? Watch your wallet at this place!!!

Everything was nice with one glaring exception......stinky, spoiled mussels!  The manager took them, returned and agreed they were bad. Her solution was free dessert and compted the mussels.  Bring big mistake for a fish house.

We've been here several times and always experienced great service and food. However, we walked out about a week ago due to awful service. We asked for a booth and were seated in the bar area. Maybe we had bar staff waiting on us and that explained the service, but there shouldn't be any difference from the main room. We ordered two salads, I had soup and appetizer, and we got a kids meal. The service was fine at first, with the kids meal coming out first, then my soup....then my appetizer....then nothing. Had to ask for more bread. About 45 min after waiting, we asked the front staff to tell the manager to get us some service. A few min later, our waiter came back, no apology, no eye contact, very sullen. He took a couple dishes away and said the food would be coming soon. Fifteen minutes later, still nothing, the waiter couldn't even be bothered to come by again. An hour after we had arrived and my husband still hadn't gotten anything to eat except the bread. We decided to leave and talked to the manager who apologized, comped what we had ordered and gave us a gift card. We'll obviously come back since this is clearly not normal for a restaurant like this, but was very surprised at such poor service on this night.

Came in with my friend around 3 and had no one greeting us to get a table. I had to beg someone to get my disabled friend a seat.  Waitress was slow getting to our table and forgot to get my friend a second glass of wine. She finally had to go to the bar to ask for another glass and there was probably only five people in the whole place.  The salad that was $8 was a handful of salad which wasn't worth the money.

Went here the other night with my bf, it was both our first time there, we wanted to try some oysters and had no idea which ones to get so our waitress Denise recommended getting the sampler.  The sampler was very good and I would definitely recommend anyone who wants to try oysters to order the sampler. Denise made our first time there a great one!

Wanted to try someplace new for our girls bi-weekly happy hour so we opted for this place because they had sushi.  The place was dead empty which should have been a red flag.  The waitress seated us and gave us both the happy hour menu and the regular menu.  When we were ready to order some apps & cocktails, the waitress rudely told us that she can't honor the happy hour prices in her area and we would need to move....so why did she even give us the happy hour menu?!   We moved over to the bar where we were greeted by a cold preoccupied snobbish bar tender. We were so uncomfortable ordering because we obviously were not welcome.  When I was ready to order I had to get up and walk over to the bar because our server never returned.   We ordered a few drinks and apps just to try this place out.  Food was mediocre and drinks ok but this def isn't a happy hour place and due to the horrible service we will not be returning.

I have no idea where to even begin to express my appreciation for this place and their staff....   It was remarkable and extremely nice to enjoy my birthday dinner at such a great delicious restaurant with management out of this world.   Michelle (Manager) was such a beautiful soul. We didn't know if she was a manager or a waitress serving us when we first sat down, until she made that clear 15 minutes in. She made us feel like we were literally guest at her own home. She was welcoming, informative, patient, fast and just soooo awesome!   Although it was sad to see her leave us, she handed us over to a great spunky waitress named Cassandra who was also very sweet and helpful!   The food was amazing!  The Buttercake was fantastic!!!   And If you make a reservation ahead of time they sit your party down quick and fast.   There are no amount of words to express my sincerest appreciation for making the end of my day a great one! We will definitely be back. Thank you so much Michelle! You are such an amazing woman and host!
Highly over priced for Red Lodster style food. I paid $22.00 for 3 shrimp and 2 scallops.  Serously better food Joes crab Shack.

Best seafood in the East Valley by far!!!! The fish is really fresh and incredibly delicious. The service is excellent. And the ambience/decor is lovely. The problem is that this restaurant is not cheap. This is not a $$ restaurant. More like a $$$$ restaurant.  But the food is so good, it's worth the splurge every now and then.

Denise is awesome and was very attentive to our party. She was very friendly and knows the menu well to make suggestions. Being from California and going to King's Fish House out here it was nice to know that the Tempe AZ staff, Denise in particular, was just as friendly!! Thank you Denise! Next time I'm in AZ I hope she's there working because I'd definitely go back!!

I went here a few days ago and I have to say it was pretty good. The angel hair with shrimp was good. The only complaint is that there wasn't enough of it. They used really shrimp, not the frozen stuff you get at most restaurants. The clam chowder was also very good. The ciopinno was good also. The amount and variety of seafood was good and the sauce it was cooked in was really good. I have had some good, and not so good ciopinno. I have to say this was pretty good.   My waiter was really nice and the atmosphere was great. The only reason I am giving them a four star is because the portion for the angel hair and shrimp was small for the price. They could have also give a couple more pieces of garlic bread with the ciopinno.

Another great experience at King's Fish House!! Consistently great service, the highest quality seafood and the prices are reasonable!! You get what you pay for!!!   We had the pleasure of meeting Michelle, the manager, and she was genuinely concerned about our opinion of how things were going.  If you are thinking about going to KFH, stop thinking and just do it. Hands down the best in the valley!!   Thanks guys for helping us have a nice Sunday lunch!!   We'll be back!!

I have driven by King's so many times and wondered how the food was.   I finally went in for dinner Saturday after a movie and was pleasantly surprised.   I had grilled catfish, rosemary potatoes and spinach.   It was great.  My friend had the trout and he loved it.  It is a little pricey though.    BTW, the movie..... Shatter Island... HATED it.    I know hate is a strong word But I really HATED it.

Good food & great service! Our waiter, Aiden, was awesome! We were seated right away on a Friday evening, no wait. This place has an extensive & impressive bar with everything from sake to JD.  My bf loves his sushi & fried fish... being able to get both was cool, but it was just good, not great.  I opted for the sirloin & it was delicious! The fried shrimp was also pretty amazing.

Ok, so we've been here  a total of two times... the first was a pretty good experience... not memorable, but ok. Then we went again, last night for Mothers Day. My Dad wanted the Trout so bad, so us Mothers gave in. The only positive thing to say about them is how nice they were, we called to see if we could get in at for dinner at 8:30pm, (they closed at 9pm) they said not a problem. I was kinda impressed cuz we've called other restaraunts and they have turned us down in the same senario.... when we sat down, we ordered right away, it took awhile for us to get our food, i finally had to flag our waitress down and ask her to bring whatever was ready whenever it was ready. My salad was probably the best thing I had that night next to the water. Come on tho, how hard is it to mess up salad and a water! My Dad had the trout, he finished it but said it wasnt the best, my Mom had the Chicken Parmesean. She picked around the stuff she didn't like. I ordered a coconut shrimp apetizer, it arrived cold. The bill for two adult entrees and one appetizer a small ceaser salad and one childs meal was $80....  we still tipped $20, but $100 for one of the worst meals in a long time wasn't worth it. We won't be back at least for awhile.

We dined here for lunch the other day and it was delicious. I had the crunchy lobster roll with a side salad and it was a perfect lunch. Jessica was our server and she was on top of everything. Our drinks were always full and she was very sweet. We will be back!

Sourdough bread is awesome. Entrée delivered before the salad was halfway finished. Waiter calls me "bud"... I am almost 50 "dude" "Dude" removes our unfinished plates without asking, the place was empty, I have a feeling why now. I wanted those fries dang it.    Old "Betty" sitting next to us warns us to avoid the sea bass but give a thumbs on the zucchini   Bud won't be back

At at Kings Fish House last night with my wife and two toddlers. We had an awesome experience mostly because of our waitress Jessica V!  She new we had kids and time was limited. She took our order right away and was so great with our kids. Jessica was such a pleasure at a time where good service is hard to find. We loved our food as well. I would highly recommend Kings Fish House for a great atmosphere and how great it was for our kids!!!  Well done Kings!
Excellent service and food. Never disappointed with any off the Kings Fish House franchise. Been to several in SoCal. Kudos to Kings!

This is a good restaurant. We are seafood fans. We ate there for the first time based on the Yelp recommendation as we were visiting from Georgia. The Hot Seafood Appetizer was splendid.  The food portions were appropriate (probably the right proportion size, but you always want more!)  The restaurant did not receive 5 stars as the fish that we ordered was bland.  The wahoo was very fresh, but the blackening was only on top and not throughout.  My daughter ordered fried catfish and had the same issue as she ordered mustard to provide more flavor.  The standout was the grilled zucchini which was excellent.  Our waitress was excellent and the food arrived promptly.  The food just needed more flavoring throughout.
Seafood Cobb is so delightful! Cassandra is always nice and super helpful! I love coming here for lunch.
Yes this is the place. Creative with all the dishes. Excellent presentation. Very clean. Restrooms clean. Staff very professional

I went here with my best friend recently. Her fish was dried out and full of bones and the waitress acted incredibly rude and pious to us. I ordered a quesadilla, and it came in a little basket cut up and stacked, was incredibly thin and tiny, and tasted funky and gave me a bad aftertaste that lasted all night. We're never coming back to Tempe Markeplace, let alone King's Fish House.

My girlfriend and I were there on Sunday the 22, we were the only people sitting at the bar, got a dozen oyesters, a poboy some tacos.  The food was good, the oyesters were fresh and the bartender was awesome.  We did some Peppar vodka and oyester shots, had some nice cold brews and enjoyed the day.  I wanted to thank the bartender also for getting my girlfriend addicted to 3 Olives Dude vodka.  You were right about the sprite mixer hahaha

Service is excruciatingly slow and the waiter had absolutely no knowledge of the menu. He had to go to the kitchen over 8 times to answer each question we had about the menu. It took 20 minutes to place our drink order and an hour to get our entrees. The portions are tiny, tiny!!!

Sorry, after 4 days of horrid food poisoning I need to drop them to 1 star... or actually no stars.  I'm confident it was the improperly prepared Cobia that left me hunkered down in the bathroom for nearly a week.  I suggest they stick to fish that is easy to prepare and turns quickly... salmon, tuna, etc...

In town for the weekend. Saw the review on King's Fish House on YELP! Certainly helped and affirmed the majority of the reviews...fantastic, yummy, and satisfying. I'd definitely recommend it to anyone on the Tempe area looking for some excellent seafood.

We were invited back as guests of the restaurant and had a good experience.  Based on our first visit we stayed with fish dishes only.  The halibut, tilapia and oysters were all excellent.  The tilapia was very good.  The halibut was excellent again.  The entrees came with two sides - we chose spinach, baked potato and rice.  The dozen oysters were $28 and were  6 different types.  After asking  about oyster happy hour specials we were told the shooter oysters (3) were $4 in the bar.  The service was also very good.  We still did not feel the entrees were a good value for the money but had a good meal.

First off, I would like to give credits to the management team of King's Fish House. Managers are open to take customers' opinions into consideration, and I found it very proficient and adequate.   As stated in my previous review, I will draft another updated review based on my last visit for lunch at this place, and also for the invitation of the management team. This time, after jumbling through the menu once again for a closer look. I decided to go for Rainbow Trout Amandine with mango salsa, plus 2 sides of sauteed spinach and grilled zucchini.  At this moment, I am impressed. The trout is crunchy from the outside, but it also contains enough moisture. The garlic sauce (you can find it on the table) and the main entree is a perfect combination together. However, the sauteed spinach is just not my taste. The sourdough bread is fresh baked, and I prefer to enjoy it with sugar and butter on top.   Once you know what to order, you can't go wrong with the your selection. They rotate the lunch menu every week, so each day they will have different specialties. Overall, my experience was improved this time. Thanks King's for the hospitality.

I went in on a whim, out shopping, saw sign, & "fish" sounded good. A Monday, late afternoon, I was recommended that the bar had Monday specials. Ordered house Chardonnay, expected "ok", it was delicious! Unexpectedly sour dough bread appeared & I took a taste & it was exquisite! I told the bartender I felt I was in San Francisco, & she said it is flown in DAILY for them! The fish tacos were a great choice, they were delicious & even though I was really hungry, I couldn't finish them!  I can't understand the negative postings here, surely having everything much better than I even expected can't be just an accident!  I am a picky eater and only expected to "grab a bite to eat" & was very pleasantly surprised!

On a Sunday after church, we decided to dine out for seafood. My friend remembered the building and sign while visiting Tempe Marketplace, so we decided to visit. Accidently walking in the bar side entrance we were pleasantly greeted and suggested to sit wherever we would like. Choosing a spacious private seating area offside the bar and restaurant allowed us to enjoy ourselves with tons of room to spread out and without the worry of disturbing others with loud laughter. A refreshing Desert Pear Margarita for happy hour made it hard to have just one! We ordered a great Coho Salmon dish which was fresh, juicy, and seasoned wonderfully and an awesome Lobster Crunch Roll as well. Friendly service from Paul the manager and Anthony the bartender; loved the special touch of meeting the chef tableside too!

Wandered in on a Friday night after walking through the mall trying to decide what to eat. Well we landed in a winner. Our waitress Timber was probably one of the best and most knowledgeable waitresses I've had in a long time. She knew the menu and offered good suggestions. The food was wonderful my guest and I had the mussels and then had the surf and turf. Everything was cooked well and was flavorful. Timber was attentive and checked in on us at the appropriate times and just overall wow'd us on service. Great place, great food, great service.

We decided to try this out after seeing other Yelp reviews. When we entered, the place was basically empty. (Probably a warning sign) After being seated, our waiter was prompt and super friendly. He answered lots of questions and gave recommendations since we are from out of town. So we thought this was going to be a fabulous experience! However, after apx 10 minutes of his help, he left to help another table. When he came back, he basically lost his friendly attitude. We had to ask for drink refills (Always a huge no-no in our book!!!) He seemed preoccupied the rest of the night (but the place was basically empty). The food was pretty good. Kids ordered sushi, I had the trout almandine, and my husband had the blackened rainbow trout. No complaints there. But the prices were steep for the meals.

Excellent seafood at reasonable prices. Menu is extensive and printed daily to assure availability. Oysters are a must starter. Good sushi also. At lest a dozen fresh fish to choose from daily. Don't missed the mashed potato side.

So you think that because this is a chain the quality of the seafood and its preparation could never be good as what you grew up with (for those of you who of course grew up on the ocean - in my case Long Island and New England).  Well, the answer is... it is a chain and it could NEVER be as equally as good.  Here comes the BIG however...  (big)HOWEVER(big), for what this place is I gotta tell ya, you can get a "thank you that was oh so close" meal here.    Firstly, the warm bread that they give you unlimited amounts of may be the best in Phoenix.  (Dude, did you just say bread?). Yes, I did!  Bread never tasted so perfect, so yummy.  Fresh out of the oven and perfect every time.    As for the meals, some are better than others and their menu here is VERY seasonal - changes out daily almost.  That said, soft shell crab was in season when we went and a bunch of us got it "Picatta" style - lemon, butter and capers.  And... Wait for it.  Wait for it... It really was almost a 10 out of 10.  Just so so good.    Thank you Kings Fish House for bringing Long Island to me and my family. Thank you for making such a beautifully prepared dish.  Thank you for making me smile inside (in my mouth and stomach) and out.    P.S. So I have heard, the meats and pastas are good not great.  So do as the Romans do... When at Kings Fish House, get FISH man!  You'll be glad you did.

It started with the waiter- horrible, then went downhill from there.  The sea bass was brown inside, the filet was tough and had a horrible taste,  the crab cakes were served with tartar sauce and were bland.  The waiter rarely came around and when he did, it was like he was forced to and doing us a favor.  Do yourself a favor,  DO NOT come here, there are much better seafood restaurants to go to that also treat you better.

I love this place. It is so much better than Red Lobster.   Menus are printed twice per day so the information is up-to-date and you never have anything run out.  The seafood is as fresh as it can be, seeing that we are nowhere near the ocean, and the variety of options is tremendous.  It isn't just your classic steamed with lemon or fried with tartar sauce.    Every experience here has been top notch. I highly recommend this place to anyone in the mood for seafood.
Love the Kings fish house.  If you go pls do yourself a favor ask for kaylin. She is a fabulous server.  So the plus you have kaylin AND fabulous food

I tried this place for lunch a few days ago.  Their lunch menu is HUGE and is probably about the same as their dinner selections except for the prices.  I wasn't in the mood for a $50 lunch so I opted for the Caesar with wild bay shrimp.  The size and price was reasonable but it was just "eh".  My buddy got the Louie salad with crab and shrimp and it looked "eh" as well.  The service was excellent.  The diet cokes almost came faster than I could drink them.  Their fish and oyster selection look great so I will definitely be back because there really aren't that many places in Tempe with decent seafood.

I really like this place although I've only been here twice.  Here are two things that happened today during lunch that make me give a five-star rating:  1.  My dining companion and I want to share our lunches.  We tell our server and without us asking, he offers to split them in the kitchen for us.  Nice - most restaurants charge for this.  2.  With our fish came not a tiny little slice of lemon that cannot possibly be squeezed without getting it all over one's fingers but instead, a half a lemon!  Wonderful.    I will add the food is quite good - crab cakes, fish and chips.  I really like everything about this restaurant and will definitely be coming back!

My husband, parents and I went to Kings Fish House at the beginning of March for my husbands birthday.  He is from Oregon, and a little bit of a seafood snob.  He really wanted seafood for his birthday meal.  We checked out places on Yelp but couldn't find any place that had great reviews and was in our price range.  We decided to take a chance on King's Fish House, and to be honest we were a little skeptical of a chain restaurant.   Not to mention my husband and his family goes clamming off of the Oregon coast several times a year, so he has high expectations for fresh clams. We were absolutely blown away by everything about this restaurant.   Our server for the night was Chris G, and he gave us some amazing recommendations.  He really listened to what flavors each of like individually and made individualized his recommendations for each of us.  Even pairing it with some wine and side dish recommendations.  Not to mention his recommendations for clams were spot on!!  Each of us had a different dish, and each of us swore we had the best dish at the restaurant.    In April we celebrated my fathers birthday, and he requested we go back to King's Fish House.  As soon as we walked in, we saw Chris. We requested him to be our server again.  Not only did he remember us, but he remembered what we had ordered a month earlier.  AMAZING!!  He gave us some new recommendations, and again his service was incredible!!  My personal recommendation... go to the Kings Fish House and sit in Chris' section.  Get some of the Skookum clams if they are in, and definitely try the Macadamia Nut Crusted Halibut.  Delicious!!  We will be back again very soon!!

This place was good! I had the king's albacore roll and the king's spicy seafood chowder. The sushi roll was delicious! The chowder was ok. It's my own lack of knowledge about soup but I was disappointed the chowder wasn't creamy. Now I know chowder means creamy OR chunky.  Plenty of room in the restaurant so you don't feel like you're sitting with the party next to you. Family friendly environment. The service was slow but I will still go back when I'm in the area and craving some seafood.

Never again... for starters the waitress kept us waiting for 10+ mins to even ask us what to drink... brought us our drinks and never returned. It wasn't until me and my friend decided to leave,  that someone tried to tend to us.   The menu options were not that good either. Hopefully no one else has to experience this.

OMG what a wonderful time and dinner we had at King's!  My sister called to make a reservation for a double birthday celebration - Mom's 99th and my 64th. Sis called the ph# on the website and actually spoke to Heath Bumgardner, VP of sales in CA. He was very helpful and took it upon himself to make the dinner reservation for us. Not only did we get the reservation set up, but when we arrived there were 2 bouquets of flowers and 2 birthday cards signed by all the staff wishing us a happy day! What a surprise and delight! Patrick, Teresa and John met us at the front door and came to our table to wish us happy birthday and to make sure we had everything we needed. We had appetizers of grilled oysters and mussels - which were delicious to say the very least - always a good dish if you are looking for more of the same thing! We moved on to lobster and sea bass - which were all prepared expertly and melted in our mouths. Of course being our birthday we had to have dessert - we shared the cheesecake and key lime pie.
