I have now officially fell in love with both!.  We will DEFINITELY be back next year for Mom's 100th!!!

I am on the fence as to whether I go with a 2star on this review or a 3. THIS is when I wish there were half stars! It's not quite a 3 and yet not as low as a 2. Oh well, I digress. You get my point, I am sure. If not, you likely may after you read my review. I had this place bookmarked in my handy dandy Yelp bookmarks for months as places I needed to try. Being from the coast of Nor Californ I A , I crave , YEARN for seafood. Last weekend my hubby and I opted for King's Fish House over another seafood place that is also on our bookmarks and more towards his office because it looked fun and lively and the menu looked good. We were also in the neighborhood. I was on the fence with what to order once I saw the Filet and South African Lobster. Again, being picky, as I notably am, I asked the waitress about the lobster and the size of the filet. She could not give me sizes on either, rather, 'It's good size and the lobster is, BIG'. Okay. That's relative. I just did a hike with my husband and I were hungry! I also asked about the Shrimp and Crab Louie, again, one of those things I LOVE from home. Same answer, "It's BIG!" Clearly our waitress was excited about the menu and thats a good thing! She can't make my mind up, so I went with the Filet and Lobster. My husband ordered the Oysters Rockefeller. They seem to be prepared differently everywhere that we travel or dine, which is a lot and all over. Did I love these? No. It wasn't the oyster. It was the sauce. It was lemony and just had a strange consistency and looked odd to me. I could not get past that. I let my husband have at it. The next course that I had was the Clam Chowder. Loved it! It was lukewarm but was still so good. Again, being from just north of SF, the bar is set pretty high for clam chowder and this was very good. We asked for bread, a) because I feel clam chowder HAS to have good bread with it!, and b) we saw it on other guests table..Envy! Oh! Did I mention and can one tell from this review that my husband and I were HANGRY !! this particular night?! We finally flagged our waitress down for the bread and she explained that she didn't understand what was up with the kitchen and , 'they seemed to be out of it and it appeared that they were baking more'. I also asked about that  glass of Pinot Noir that I had ordered. She looked a little confused but got it. Now our dinner arrives. When I have any steak anywhere, I always check the done-ness of it first, because at times, its over done. This would be one of those times. This was more like medium to done in the center and no pink on the edges. The filet was also not juicy. Was it 'good sized' , as she claimed when I initially asked? No. This is where I always have an issue as a customer: DO I say anything? I mean, she seems busy! Am I being high maintenance? I've already asked for the bread; requested the late Pinot! NOW the filet is off! THEN as a Yelper, I leave a review and someone then messages me, or has and says , "Hey! Did you let the waitress know?" In this case, my husband says, " That is a $45. meal. We are telling her." The lobster was good. Not great. It was good. Maybe the food had sat for a few before she could get it to us? It happens on busy nights! I waitressed back in the day in college! I know how it goes! So she comes and we explain. She states that she will see if she can re-do it and a few minutes later she comes back to say they are re-doing a steak for me. Several minutes later, as my husband is pretty much done with his meal and I have finished most of my lobster and now down to the part of what is a baked potato that isn't fully done... (not raw, but not cooked enough to eat), out comes another filet with a different person who asks me to cut into it while she watches. I cut into the middle and it doesn't look medium rare either , but it did look juicer and hot. I do not want to deal with this all evening and I am pretty much over it at this point. She walks away and the same thing. This time the edges of the steak were even more done than the first! I would not think this is that difficult! I've cooked filets at home; its simple to get a medium rare steak! As I said, I was over trying to get it correct at that point. I did like what was cooked of the baked potato! I probably didn't need the entire thing anyway, as it was pretty big! The Sautéed Spinach side was cooked perfectly and I took that home after being full and added it to my eggs the next day. The Pinot was good, as well and the waitress, she totally tried! She was cheerful to the end with us! We thought she was great! Now the bus girl cleaning the table behind us who spilled water and then said, "OH SH*&! " in a whispering voice; Well. We heard that and that's probably not okay! The decor was nice and the patio seemed fun. We also liked being able to call ahead and get a reservation with no issues. See, it's not all bad. Would I come back? Probably not. Back to my bookmarks!

I'm not a fish fan, but the group I was with was, so as long as there's some non-fish on the menu, I'm fine with it.  It's a nice place, and the service was friendly and attentive. The cocktail napkins with incredibly corny fish jokes (where do fish borrow money? a loan shark) was kind of a fun addition.  I ordered a pasta dish which included chicken, peppers, and a creamy tomato-based sauce. It was good, but I don't know if it was $14 good. Prices went up from there for the various fish dishes, but I can't really judge those without trying them.  I've got no complaints, and I'd probably go back if I'm with people that want to go, but I think I can find similar quality food for me at about 4 or 5 dollars less for lunch.

4 Fabulous stars! My mom and her boyfriend were in town and I have heard good things about this place so we decided to check it out. My spring mix salad was good, but standard. Let's face it, we did NOT go for the salad anyway. I ordered the Parmesan crusted Sand Dabs with my two choices as garlic mashed potatoes and steamed veggies. My Sand Dabs were fabulous! I had only had them one other time at McCormick & Schmicks and I think these were just a tad bit better. They were perfectly fried. I must admit the sides were a tad bit lacking. My husband ordered the Mexican coconut shrimp and they were quite good as well. Mom's boyfriend ordered Halibut Almondine and was in love at first bite. My mom had a salmon dish and she was also quite pleased with her choice. Now. I can over look the standard salad and the slightly ordinary sides but this place gets -1 solid star for the dessert. I ordered creme brule... one of my favorites. It tasted like it was from a box. A standard custard... Blech! I held out on dessert every other night we went out to dinner and this place was quite a disappointment. Now on the other hand my husband and mom both devoured their bread pudding with out complaint and the mom's boyfriend claimed his key lime pie was only second to one and that's saying A LOT.   Now. This place COULD have been 3 stars but they got the bump up for the following reasons:  -Fresh fish flown in with menus printed daily  -I caught a buzz off two martinis.  -We were all happy with our selections which is quite a feat.   Should have been 3 stars because:  -price is on the higher side... I'd rather go to McCormick & Schmicks for the price  -crappy desserts.   I admit I am a little surprised to see some of the reviews at 1 or 2 stars. We had great service and our food came out in a timely manner, as did our drinks.

So after spending $150 on dinner for 4 people, without alcohol, I have to say the food was horrible.  I would have complained more at the time but we were celebrating my parents 50th anniversary and I didn't want to ruin their evening.  My $25 salmon dish was overcooked and for some god forsaken reason they put a ton of spice on it.  My husband's fish was also dried out and tasteless.  The only things that were good were the cheese grits and spinach.
$21.00 for 3 shrimps and 2 scalops. Very disappointed in the serving size. See photos!
Fish tacos were good.  Sever was pleasant and took good care of us.  We enjoyed the outdoor seating.   Go here and not Dave and Busters.

My wife and I have gone to this place twice. The first time the service was mediocre, but the food was excellent. Today, we went back because we wanted to try their sushi. Overall it was a good visit, the service was OK, the sushi was good, but they didn't do a very good wrapping for the sashimi. I don't think we'll go back I'm just not sure it was worth the bucks.

It was my pleasure to again visit Kings Fish House in Tempe Marketplace. The food and service is always great. The Seafood Chowder is great. Spicy and piping hot.  It was our good fortune to take a seat in one of the gigantic booths in the bar tonight, Fat Tuesday. Among the talents that stand out, was Gilbert who is a great talent.  The outstanding feature of this restaurant is that they operate on the "Team concept". If Gilbert gets tied up, another talent jumps in to help, including the supervisor.  Good food, wonderful people make for a great night out.  Did I mention the rich wood tone decor. You can't do better.

Came in with my best friend and her family and had an amazing experience! We were sat on the patio and it was beautiful and the temperature was perfect. There was a decent variety of menu items from sushi, to fish, to pasta, to sandwiches. Our waiter and even the staff passing by our table were personable and attentive! A bottle of wine, lobster, and good friends... ideal night!

They have fish, a good selection of it and decent quality.  I have been to other locations of this chain, was was not expecting too much for my lunch.  We starked with the ahi poke which was decent, could have used a little wasbi to enhance the flavors.  I shared a bit of the grilled artichoke appetizer, which for being healthy was great.   For my main I had the Seared Ahi Tuna $16.95 with 2 sides. The tuna was surprisingly great, thick, no sinuousness at all great color and flavor. The sides selection is also quite impressive and one can even have a small salad as one of the sides.  You can't avoid some of the chain quirks, like why am i given tartar sauce with seared ahi, and not soy and wasabi / ginger  Service was decent given our large group, and the ambiance is a notch above family casual, I would call it business casual.   Overall it is not a cheap meal, but good fish rarely is.

I'm going to come out and say I rarely give a chain restaurant five stars. You know why? Because I am slightly pretentious and believe high quality food and creativity is lost the more commercial you get. Ok, so now that I am have gotten off my high horse here is the deal.   Apps. We ordered the cocktail shrimp half pound. They had been flown in that day and we're fresh as fresh can be and they were fantastic. They are presented on a bucket of ice which is just freaking awesome. We asked for extra horseradish and guess what came.... Actual freaking root. The good stuff. The shake your moneymaker real deal holyfield root.   I ordered the Nawlins Shrimp. My server described it as sweet and spicey. Rarely do I pick up both sides but seriously. This time was a hit. The Nawlins BBQ shrimp was fantastic. Sweet and spicey and full of flavor. Very similar to a gumbo.   For desert we had the buttercake. Seriously, it, was, awesome. Sweet and salty. This is an awesome place that although has a chain feel, brings the heat, and the sweet.

Great food, and great service with a lovely smile from Cassandra! :) We were seated quickly and all of our (many) questions were answered quickly and knowledgeably. I enjoyed the nice dining experience. We'll be back!

We decided to stop in tonight after some shopping at the Tempe Market Place.  We haven't been there in a while and we all felt like seafood, and Kings is our go to sea food place.  I will start off by saying that our server John was very attentive and never had to be reminded of anything.  Very much a plus when you want to have a nice evening.  I ordered something not on the menu and he asked the kitchen if they were able to prepare my scallops the way i like them which is pan seared.  The only thing I suggested after I got them is that they should have been seasoned with a sprinkle of salt and pepper. Otherwise they were perfectly cooked, not crowded in the pan which as any cook worth their salt would know that steams scallops and they become rubbery.  These had a great sear on them.  My husband had linguini and clams and he really enjoyed that the clams came out in their shells because he said they were fresh and not canned white clam sauce.  Of course I would be remiss if I did not mention that this is about the only place in Phoenix that you can get sourdough bread that tastes like the piers in San Fransisco.  To finish off our night the manager Miriam came over to ask us how everything was and we were happy to tell her how great the service was and she told us that John had only been there a short time.  I told her they need to keep him because he made the night worth our while as well as the food.  Good job folks keep it up!  We'll be back when it is wild salmon season.

I went on a local seafood restaurant kick over the holidays, including serving King Crab for Christmas Dinner. Check out all my current reviews.   Everyone knows it's thin picking when it comes to "fresh seafood" in Phoenix, but Kings Fish House at Tempe Marketplace is the standout IMO. Kings is actually a wholesale fish distributer out of Santa Ana, CA. This allows their Fish House's to have one of the largest seafood selections in Southern Cal.   Been coming to the Tempe location since it opened, a solid 4 star seafood "eating" experience. Their selections are extensive, I suggest you check out the online menu to prepare yourself before you visit. While the decor is modern and clean, to be honest, its just a tad boring for me. The oyster bar should be just jumping ... but they have a totally clueless happy hour, the place just lacks excitement!  The quality of the seafood and large selection of fresh oysters at Kings Fish House puts Pappadeaux to shame, but the low energy keeps Kings from being more popular IMO. Rarely is the bar or restaurant over half full, I guess that good or bad depending on your viewpoint or philosophy.  A much more creative happy hour experience and late night "live local Jazz" would really put this place on the map ... yet still fit their theme.   The potential of Kings Fish House is off the chart ... if only they could light a fire under the local management.
I think seafood restaurants are one the toughest eateries to do well. I had the sushi plate, and my husband had the Ono grilled. Both were okay, but nothing to brag about.

Visiting PHX so we wanted to try something we did not have back home. Walked in and was greeted by a friendly hostess who quickly sat us at our table. She did great and earned one of the two stars above. Asked if it was our first visit which it was and continued to welcome us as we walked to our table. Then the waitress came and took our drink orders and also asked if it was out first visit. She then explained the menu in detail and answered our questions. I ordered the fish and chips and my wife ordered the fried shrimp. Up until this point our visit was fine and the helpfulness of the waitress earned the second star. The water tasted funny but we chalked it up to being in a different city. Once the food came I grabbed a fry which they were delicious. The waitress came by and asked how are "first bites" were. Well I had not taken one yet but my wife answered "so far so good". Then I thought to myself that's different, but thought it was cool that she came to check on us right away. Well that first bite of fish was disgusting. The fish was extremely oily and slimy. The batter was raw on the underside or so soggy from the oil that it tasted raw. I really wanted to like it cause I was starving so I tried the other piece, NOPE same nastiness. So I let my plate sit there till the waitress came by again. A few minutes later she came by and instead of asking if everything was ok she asked if I was finished and took my plate. Now, who sees a full plate of food with one small bite missing from the main part of the dish and assumes I'm done and that everything was ok!?!?!  I'm not a child, I'm a full grown 225 pound man. How many grown men that you know eat two bites of a $20 plate and then are full? Not once did she ask again how our meal was. Just brought the check and that was it. So since I wasn't asked I paid for my meal, left a note about the fish and told them to look for my review on Yelp. Then I walked out hungry and ate some McDonald's on the way home. If I can eat McDonald's you know my expectations are not that high but the fish at Kings was so subpar I would have rather paid $20 for a filet - O - fish sandwich. Lol. Needless to say we will not be returning, must've been why the restaurant was so empty at prime dinner time on a Friday night. Should've been a red flag when we walked in. Waitress if your reading this it's nothing against you. I know you didn't cook that crap. But learn from it. You got potential but pay attention.

Started with oysters and Chardonnay - then grilled Tilapia, rice, and zucchini - a perfect meal!    All recommended by our beautiful bartender who looked exactly like Thandie Newton!  Then - walk the mall at tempe mkt place. Very nice!!!!

Hungry ? Want something to eat , like maybe fish?  Well this place has fish.  This is the kind of place to go when you want food but not really caring how good it COULD be .  Service was great and very prompt. The host  , bartender, and wait staff seemed very into their jobs.  But the fish itself was not memorable.    A bit pricey , but offered many kinds of fish which seemed to be flown in?   I wouldn't go back unless a group of people were meeting there and it was what everybody else wanted. Enough said.

I dined at KIng's Fish House last night after happy hour.  King's has ample indoor and outdoor seating and was crowded. I ordered the char broiled Swordfish with mashed potatoes, brocoli and a diet coke. Carol was my server and did a great job of refreshing my water and diet coke. The Swordfish was cooked to perfection and delicious as well as my sides. My bill was $28 before tip; kind of pricey but what can you do during lent?  Excuse me while I rant a little,  I was seated in one of those benches with the two chairs on the other side (seating for 4) instead of seating me in a booth for two.This seems to be the logic employed at many restaurants when there is a single diner; it's like being put at the kid's table during Thanksgiving. It didn't help that there was this 2 year old next to me that would emit these shrill strident yelps every few minutes. The mother finally got a clue when she was starred down by a grandmotherly type at an adjoining table and went outside when her kid was acting up again.

Amazing dinner for my Mom's  birthday! She so loved her 99th dinner, we had to go back! She received the special treatment that she deserved! Thank you Michelle, Lindsay and Kaylin..and our server..sorry didn't get her name! And the entire staff..it was a very special event for us!!!
Love the meals that truly #inspire me! #parmesancrustedAlaskanSandDads, mashed potatoes and fresh corn.... my palate is doing a happy dance. Thanks Michelle and @kingsfishhouse! #datewithhayes

Went here for a friend's b-day. The food was ok, service was mediocre, had to ask the waiter for water about 4 times, before actually getting it. They serve a variety of seafood, which really isnt that memorable, when I say memorable, I mean you can find better seafood at another place.   Prices are ridiculously expensive, I understand its seafood, but come on! I wont be returning unless I get a gift card from someone, even then I'll consider re-gifting it!

I ate dinner here with a friend and her parents. Everything on the menu looked fantastic but I decided to be good and order trout with glazed carrots instead of pasta or fried fish with fries. My friend's mom ordered crab cakes before her meal and offered me a bite. I was impressed it was all crab and lightly breaded on the outside just the way I like em! I enjoyed my trout and tried my friend's halibut and her mom's Alaskan Sanddab. Both were equally delicious. We finished our meal with key lime pie and creme brulee. I am extremely picky about what seafood restaurants I will eat at and I give King's Fish House two thumbs up!

for being located in a land-locked state, the seafood was really good. i had this spicy bbq shrimp dish and the shrimp was done perfectly. it definitely had a lot of spice, so if you like spicy food, this one's for you.  the clam chowder was not too thick and not watered down. could have a little more seafood in it, but still worth eating. the service was really good, our waitress was super nice i didn't have to ask/wait for a refill on my drink. will go back if in the area.

Overpriced is the first word that comes to mind.  And the word that dominates my feelings toward this place.  They never mentioned that the "KING" in the name actually  means you have to be as RICH as a REAL KING to afford to eat here.  $13.95 for a ( relatively forgettable ) simple oyster Po' Boy with 5 oysters on it and a side of fries?   Yep.  Who's dumber - me for paying it, or them for charging it?  I think Me.  When I saw the price, I should have just closed the menu and left.  I also had a $6.95 "Cajun Bloody Mary" which had nothing Cajun about it, as far as I could tell.  It was mostly ice, served in a 16-oz glass.  So maybe about 6 ounces of "drink material" inside.  It lasted about as long as it took me to take 5 drinks out of it.  Let's do the math:  At $6.95, with 6 ounces of substance, that comes to $148.26 per gallon.    So at least I can say I had a Bloody Mary which came in at around $148 a gallon.  I will never, EVER go back to that place.  And if you do go, bring the credit card with the highest available balance, because you are gonna need it.  P.S.  A manager attempted to contact me after seeing this review, trying to make things right for me.  I understand their prices reflect the "going rate" for fresh seafood in the desert.  I've upped the star from 1 to 2 to reflect the respect for management for trying to contact me and make things right.  Kudos for that.  P.S.P.S.  I had Pete's Fish and Chips the other day, and I realized that their fried oysters are the EXACT SAME ONES which are served at King's Fish House.  So if you want to know what these fried oysters taste like, eat at Pete's.  You can get about 15 oysters there for the King's price.

Let's say you're driving down the road with an extra twenty bucks you don't know what to do with.  You're hungry, it's lunchtime, and you come here.   King's Fish House  Where you can get an entire glob of tuna fish smeared between two slices of whole wheat bread. An artful creation resembling something your eight year-old niece would throw together, this along with a fistful of french fries and some bitter-as-gall deli slaw, and all for surrendering that dirty twenty! Actually it's 10.95 but with the diet coke and the tip, you're now up around twenty.   Other delights our party sampled were from the "Fried" section.  The menu description only reading Farm Raised Mexican Shrimp. It didn't say how these little Mexican Shrimp numbered only four.  Or how they must've been raised in one of the Kennedy's swimming holes in the Hampton's where they were fed fois gras and cavear, sipped champagne from gold-rimmed flutes, and had their own nanny, wistfully lulling them to sleep each night with old Raffi tunes.  Because at 13.95 for four of these little bastards, they must've led one pampered life on that farm!  Three of us. Two tuna fish sandwiches. And one small school of Mexican Shrimp, a water, a diet coke and an iced tea....48.95, with ten bucks for the tip, almost sixty bucks.  Unless you're dining on the company expense account, or someone else is picking up the tab, theres no reason on earth to pay twenty bucks for a tuna fish sandwich and a diet coke.  Or for that matter,  watch your friend eat  four of the Kennedy's prized pets.

I loved this place despite the reviews. Our food was excellent, service was amazing, and everything was clean. Those are the three things I always look for and this place passed with flying colors. Would highly recommend if you're ever in the mood for some good seafood.

Given previous mixed reviews, I was expecting a decent meal, but nothing like what it ended up with. Probably the most enjoyable meal I've had in years - every course was outstanding for both me and my wife. Excellent service as well. The highlight was the YellowfinTuna (following their recommendation for medium rare, which was just right), with perfectly cooked asparagus and a creamy, cheesy Mac'n'cheese. No doubt at all that we'll return next year when we're back for Spring Training!

Horrible service and my food was cold. If they had been busy, I MIGHT understand, seeing as I used to be a server myself. But we were the only people in the place. And considering that I've had such great experiences at other King's locations, I was very disappointed.
The King crab was awful tonight. of course I said nothing because my server was so awesome but they were over cooked and shrunken

I come here for the oysters and a cadillac margarita.  And it is awesome, every time. They have possibly the best oysters in Phoenix (shhh!).  The kids gets fish and chips when we visit, and from what i've sampled, that is good too.  As for the rest of the menu?  Who knows.   The options are plentiful, but nothing inspires me to stray from my usual.  For whatever reason this place is not very popular, which means you can get a nice booth to yourself.  Steep prices, location, or fade-into-the-background vibe could be a factor for keeping others away...  but personally, I like that it isn't too crowded.  Sometimes you want  a spot to get away from noise and this fits the bill.

Ate here on Father's Day plus 1, a hot Monday evening!  My son invited me out to celebrate his Dad, a loving gesture.  At 5:15 PM the place was very quiet, but then to be expected on a Monday night after a holiday.  The restaurant had a somewhat rustic appeal to the inner fisherman.  It had a clean look and no fishy odors detected.  The booth was large and comfortable.  Our server was pleasant and efficient.  My son ordered "Jumbo Shrimp Ballerine", (Tomatoes, garlic, basil and white wine) with tail-on shrimp, looked like about 8, with pasta in a mild red sauce with chunks of stewed tomatoes .... (18.95).  Not a lot of flavor but the medium shrimp were fresh tasting.  For starters I had a cup of King's Spicy Seafood Chowder .... (5.25) (but a dollar off with an entree).  Fabulous chowder, loaded with fish and potatoes, very spicy but super delicious.  This alone would  get me to return!  Next came Wild Costa Rican Mahi Mahi.... (21.95) which I ordered blackened, accompanied by Grilled Zucchini and Sauteed Fresh Spinach.  The veggies were vibrantly colored and super fresh tasting.  I had to send back the spinach because it was cold which our waiter did rapidly and graciously.  The fish was perfectly cooked, reminded me of New Orleans.  No room for desert unfortunately.  This is a very nice place for tasty fresh and properly cooked seafood, in a pleasant atmosphere.  I shall return.

A restaurant with "fish" as part of it's name should know how to cook fish perfectly.  I ate there twice because I wanted to give them a second chance...mistake.  The fish was overcooked and dry (both times) and the lobster was rubbery.  It was such a let down.  The lobster bisque that Costco sells is far better than the bland version at Kings.  They did have a decent California roll though.  I was disappointed and will avoid this place in the future.
What a wonderful place, amazing food!!  Great service!! I had the most amazing steak and lobster for my birthday dinner!! My first visit and definitely not my last!!

Nice establishment. Booths are nice and long so you aren't crammed into the persons arm, next to you. The menu provided a pretty decent selection. They have a lot of oyster and clam options, but I didn't try any as I don't like oysters or clams. The rest of the menu offered some great fish dishes and some steaks, salads and burgers. I opted for the king crab legs, they were hot and tasty. The sides were pretty good, although the garlic potatoes were just a bit on the dry side. Hubby got a Filet mignon. It was grilled perfect, and very good. He wasn't a fan of the cooked spinach side, but everything else was good. He enjoyed the coffee stout, and said it was nice because it didn't have an "after-bite" like some of the stouts can.  Our waiter was a 8/10. Although at first he got our drinks and then didn't return to our table for almost 10 minutes, once he came and got out order, he was much more attentive, and came to refill our drinks often. We sat and visited for quite a while, so we were sure to drop some extra tip on the table since we took up one of his booths. Overall, I was pleased with the visit. We will return again.

3.5 stars  After a failed attempt to dine elsewhere, we ended up at King's.  Unlike Maria Maria, King's was more than happy to promptly seat us without an unnecessary wait.  There is quite an extensive menu, and a lot of complaints on Yelp about price.  I didn't think it was all that expensive.  Most of the entrees were under $20 and that includes two sides.  I had the crab cakes with french fries and mac 'n cheese.  The crab cakes were good even if not the best I've had.  Mac 'n cheese fell a little short for me.  Not much cheese.  More like mac 'n bread crumbs.  My husband had the king crab legs.  Expensive ($43) but 1 1/2 lbs and tons of crab meat.  I tried and it was delicious.  We had excellent service.  Could not have asked for better!  My one suggestion would be to serve the sourdough bread warm!  At least until June!

Came to celebrate an anniversary. Love the concept of this place, but the service was very sub par. Our waiter was quite cold with us. When asking if he recommended the calamari, he said "well, it's fried." Brilliant. My salmon was completely flavorless, and the apple cobbler had no dough. It was just crumbs, apples, and ice cream. I was hoping for much more... Very disappointed. One star for the atmosphere and the other for the fresh-baked bread.

King's Fish House has become one of my favourite places for seafood.  Seattle is one of my homes away from home, so I am picky when it comes to my seafood preferences.  I want things to be fresh from the ocean and deliciously prepared.  The first time I went to King's, was after an afternoon of running errands.  I had seen it and been uncertain of what to think.  I was seated quickly and given sour dough bread quickly.  The lemondrop martini was perfect.  Many bars get this simple drink wrong, but not King's--it had the sugar rim and perfect balance of lemon juice, vodka, and other ingredents that I wanted. The raw oysters were delicious and presented appetizingly.  My trout almondine was flaky and fresh, served with a wonderful side of rosemary new potatoes.  I felt completely spoilt and decadent when I left.   My other visits have been equally stellar.  One time, the server offered to get me an item not on the regular menu: salmon served on a cedar plank.  The salmon was covered with a delicious assortment of spices and carmelized brown sugar.  It makes me want to get my own cedar plank for cooking.  I can't wait to go back!  The selection and freshness of the raw oysters alone are reasons to check it out, along with the retro decor.  KUDOS!

My girlfriend brought me here to satisfy a seafood craving. It has a good atmosphere, and a decor that reminds me of a dignified New England bah (bar).  The server Aiden was awesome. The kitchen made a small goof in timing and he offered us options to maximize the pace of our dinner experience. That was a subtle thing made a huge difference. I'll eat here again just to sit at his table.  The food wasn't miraculous, but I'm certain I'll have a hard time finding better shrimp or scallops.
Came here for the first time for some oysters! The oysters & shooters were phenomenal & Jeremy's service was even better. :)

An upgrade to five stars is necessary after weekly fish lunches for the past several months.  I have managed to cycle thru the various seasonal "wild" salmon plus a portion of the other fish.  For me it is hard not to order salmon but will be forced to make a change in the fall at the end of the season.  Today was the Wild Kuskokwim River Coho Salmon summer salad with asparagus, tomatoes, blue cheese and fennel in an orange-soy vinaigrette.  An excellent recommendation by the waitress versus my standard cedar plank roasted salmon that masks the rich mild salmon flavor.  This time simply grilled and very, very tasty.  What I am really beginning to like about King's Fish House is excellent service in the center section under my favorite fish.  The mighty AK Chinook King Salmon...I remember catching a similar King 20 years ago on the Kenai River in AK.  My dad and I each caught Kenai King Salmon on separate days.  Each fish was 42 inches long but mine had 27 inch girth and my dad's fish had a 26 inch girth.  The scale was broken so never knew what they actually weighed (40 to 45 #).  My dad claimed his fish was larger so there you go.  The photo of us holding the fish at sunset with a background river shot is proof of their size but not of their quality.  As I recall they were the best tasting fish ever but 20 years is a long time to try to remember taste.  As far as service goes either waitress knows that I start with a Kiltlifter  but not the size - sometimes 16 oz and sometimes 22 oz.  Both waitresses know I like salmon but if the same type of salmon is on the menu I have switched to sea bass or rock fish.  Hard to believe but sometimes change is good but I almost always remember to go back to salmon the next time.

I was delighted when I was contacted by Sarah (manager) through Yelp to elaborate a little more about my negative experience at King's Fish House 2-3 weeks ago. I sent her a message back through Yelp giving her my personal email so Danny the GM could contact me but I have never heard anything back since. Maybe they dont check Yelp that often.. I am not sure what the reasoning is..  :o(

I am not the biggest fan of seafood, but I happened to visit here and Nicole (bartender) took very good care of us. She was definitely pleasant and had a lot of suggestions for our likings. She is an excellent server!

Went there on a client lunch and was pleasantly surprised at how good it was. I had the Parmesan Crusted Sand Dabs which also came with two sides so I had the sautéed spinach and house salad. Everything was so fresh and so good.   We had a group of 7 and service was great. I will definitely be going back!

My wife and I have dined at this chain's Long Beach, CA location as well as the Tempe, AZ location.  Based on those previous experiences we chose the Tempe location as the place we wanted to dine on our 45th wedding anniversary.  Based on this most recent experience I don't think we will be back.  First, we were both disappointed with the portion size.  My wife ordered the grilled catfish and she was served 4-5 ounces of fish.  Normally, one would think in terms of an 8 oz portion, especially catfish, which is one of the more common of fish.  She thought it tasted OK, but just OK, nothing special.  I ordered the ono, one of my favorite pacific fish, and I also got about a  5 ounce portion.  It was good, but nothing special.  The catfish was $17.50 and the ono was $20.75.  Very skimpy portions for the price.  There is a $1.50 extra charge of you want asparagus.  That's a little high given that most grocery stores sell it for about that much per pound in season.  My wife got about 6 stalks.  For sides I chose mac and cheese and the corn.  I got mashed potatoes and corn.  The mac and cheese was promptly brought out when I noted the problem.  It was good, but you only got about 4 ounces.  The corn was so loaded with silk that it was barely edible.  My wife said her mashed potatoes were good.  The wine list was standard, nothing outstanding.  Prices for wine were average$7.50 - $11.00 per glass for most choices.  Service was OK, but just OK.  The waiter did not seemed impressed with our response to his questions that we were celebrating our 45th anniversary.   "Cool.  I've been married ten years," he responded (at leasat he didn't say "Awesome.").  Good for him.  He never asked if we wanted a second glass of wine, which cut his tip, of course.  He did come back once to ask if everything was OK.  My wife questioned the size of her portion, but he just said that that was what the kitchen prepared.  Tip and tax put us over $80 for just a so-so meal.  I could not recommend this restaurant.
Totally average quality and taste... over-priced chain. Service is always lacking. I don't go here by my own choice.

The food was mediocre and the service was just as mediocre as the food. Nothing to brag about but not horrible. Definitely not worth the price because of the lack of service. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

Really just lackluster. The service was friendly, but the food left much to be desired. Very pricey for what it is. Everything seemed very dry. Edible, but not memorable in the least. I can't imagine why anyone would eat here twice. We won't be back.

FOOD: my mom and I decided to splurge a little and MAY have gotten a little more food than we needed! Ha! CLAM CHOWDER: super yummy! It was creamy (as it should be) and had plenty clams! My favorite thing about the soup was how they chopped the potatoes into small pieces. I know...it's a weird thing to care about, but I do not like big chunks of potatoes so it was perfect! 1/2 DOZEN OYSTER SAMPLER: pretty good, but my mom said she's had better. They were on the smaller side. SHRIMP TAQUITOS: hmmm I think we envisioned these to be made a different way than they were. They weren't horrible, but noting amazing. The shrimp was good, but the wrapper they used was meh.  ROASTED BEETS SALAD: yum!!! So refreshing and delicious! The combination of the beets, nuts, cheese and berries was amazing! Must try (if you like beets)!!!  SERVICE: quick and our server was friendly! No complaints!  PARKING: it's located in the temple marketplace so plenty of free parking.  ATMOSPHERE: Has both indoor and outdoor seating and a lot of space. Very clean and nice decor.
Jason was a great server and did awesome. Had the mahi mahi. For the price, there should have been twice the fish IMHO. Nice place.

This place has the tastiest clam chowder I've had anywhere. My boyfriend would agree. We were served by Gilbert and he was absolutely wonderful. When he noticed we hadn't been brought any complimentary bread before the beginning of our meal, he gave us a freshly baked loaf. It was so delicious we didn't mind that we got to enjoy it after our meal! He even offered to bag some up for us to take home since they were closing and planning on throwing the rest out. It was so nice of him - he must have noticed how much I was enjoying it!

When I'm going to a seafood restaurant I have slightly higher expectations for, well, everything than normal. I know the prices will be higher than most other fair and believe the experience should be better. Feel free to tell me how I'm mistaken.   I had the grilled salmon with zucchini with sauteed spinach. It was fine. Nothing special about it. Nothing about the dish made me think, I have to come back here.

I did not like my meal at all. The swordfish was the thinnest fillets I've ever seen. Made me wonder if it was swordfish. Roasted rosemary potatoes were actually deep-fried and had no Rosemary. The crabcakes tasted more like a plain Fishcake.

Went in with low expectations cause of the reviews but a few made me believe there was hope. I sat down and was promptly greeted by my waiter, Brian. He was friendly and offered a few good suggestions on what to eat. I ended up ordering the clam chowder which was really good. All in all it surpassed my expectations.

It's more like 3 1/2 stars. Not a fan but wasn't turned-off either. I guess if the service was quicker the experience would have been more enjoyable ~ That is where I am not a fan. It took FOREVER to get our appetizer...then an eon to get our entrees. It wasn't busy, as there were only 4 occupied tables present (small parties of 2-4). It took 25 minutes for us to receive our Cold Seafood Platter appetizer. Possibly another 10-15 minutes for our entrees after we finished our appetizer. Not sure where the service failure originated, if it was the kitchen or our server. But they were slower than a herd of turtles. I did enjoy my meal. It was definitely enough so fill me up. The quality was good. The taste satisfying. Presentation appealing. I ordered the King Crab Legs that come along with 2 side. I chose the Grilled Zucchini and Caesar Salad. The zucchini was grilled to perfection. The caesar salad was a liitle dry. It could have had a little more dressing added to it. This wasn't my first time here. It won't be the last time either. There are few places in the Phoenix Valley to get select fresh seafood at lunch time. This place beats the socks off of Seafood Market off of Baseline in the Dana Park Plaza. The prices are a little higher but much worth it as the quality of the fish and seafood is exceptional for being in the desert.

The hostess was pleasant.  The waiter was courteous and efficient.  For the most part the experience was fine, but we went as a group and most of us echoed what many previous reviews say: it's just plain overpriced.  The food is Denny's quality and Morton's prices.      I got the Cobb Salad which should be easy, but right away my problem was that it was $17 and mostly a plate of iceberg lettuce with a few other ingredients thrown on to break up the bland, pale green presentation.    I expect a bowl of iceberg lettuce to masquerade as a "salad" at McDonald's or maybe as a dinner salad included with a meal at Denny's.  Otherwise iceberg lettuce should never be used outside of a nursing home.    My companions had several other dishes, but all had the same feedback, nothing really wrong, but the prices seemed way out of line for the quality of food that they got.   If you are going to spend $20 to $30 a person for a meal (before alcohol or dessert), you have much, much better options.

Love seafood, Kings is delicious with lots to choose from.  Went here for dinner just before a show we were going to attend.  My regular fish fry was delicious, batter crunchy and crispy.  Like they say "I can't believe I ate the WHOLE thing!".  I have been here a few times and my only caveat is it still is no match for a Buffalo NY fish fry with haddock.  Can't get that here.  But whenever I want/need seafood this is the place to go.

Really!  Overpriced! My fish (halibut)dry and overcooked. Hubby's swordfish he said "very good"  Terrible rosemary potatoes dry and floury...nasty carrots. Grilled zucchini ok. Less than impressed with a meal that was $100 plus. Service ok, but we were not asked if everything was good. Won't be back! SAD
The food was good and service was excellent. I was only confused when we came in. Didn't know whether to wait or seat ourselves.

Met a friend for lunch here today (3/13/15) and had a very nice lunch.  I had the Albacore Tuna Salad and it was really very good.  She had the fish and chips and it looked very good also.  The server was very accommodating and although I have been there several times, I will always go back.  Food has always been good.  Not necessarily inexpensive but that is usually the case at good seafood restaurants here in AZ.  It always seems fresh!!

I have been to King's a few times in the past. Every time I go here I am never disappointed. My colleagues were very impressed with their first time here so, after that experience, I had to write a review.    I took my colleagues to lunch at King's and I went against my normal order of Ahi and went for another type of Tuna. Albacore. I had the "World Class" Tuna Melt and the Oysters Rock. Everyone knows that I make the best tuna melt on this planet but I would have to say that King's makes the second best, bar none :) The bread was perfectly toasted and very hot when it arrived. The Tuna was the perfect temperature and it was served with a smile. The Oysters were fresh and the tasty. The rest of my party had some sushi rolls, Salmon cakes, Swordfish, and the jumbo white shrimp. They all devoured their meals, like I did.   Service was fantastic. We had a party of six and we started at the bar. We ordered the food and had a drink but then we decided to move to a table to be more comfortable. I noticed it was busy and I felt a little bad for asking the bartender to move us but it didn't even phase her. I could tell she was busy but she didn't once flinch like it was a big deal. In fact she kept going above and beyond. Her sharp attentiveness to our table aside, she served all of our food without "auctioning" the food at the table, which I can't stand. Remember I told you we moved to a table after ordering from the bar and the fact that she was busy to begin with. Trust me when I tell you that this is no easy feat. Most people wouldn't even notice this type of service; It's called "seamless service". Drinks were always full and the table was maintained very neatly. I was impressed.  I've always been a fan of King's but this experience changed me to an advocate.
I had the char broiled sea scallops and they were cooked perfectly. My husband had linguini with clams and he loved his also. If we didn't live 6 hours away this would be our new favorite.
Outstanding seafood and desserts are to die for. I had the seafood platter and my wife had the blackened mahi mahi. For dessert we shared the chocolate cake and it was outstanding.
Great food and wonderful service, Cassandra took great care of us.  Will definitely be back for the macadamia nut crusted fish.  Desert was very good too.

Payed 20+ bucks for a piece of wahoo the size of a fun size snickers bar, overcooked to the point that it tasted like a burnt pork chop. Drink sat empty for multiple 15-20 minute intervals. Total bill came out to $125,  yet everybody left still hungry. Hell of a way to waste a birthday dinner. Should've been tipped off by the fact that there was nobody waiting to be seated on a Friday night.

My first few trips to kings were average at best between the service and food. Most recently I went and had the best service I've ever had from Kelsi. She was energetic and professional. Kings kept me coming back for the food but after my encounter with Kelsi I will be making my way back more often! Thanks Kelsi!

I normally do not leave one star reviews, however I was in this location yesterday for lunch and ordered the rainbow trout almondine. I chose it because it was the chefs special. It was terribly overcooked and the sauce was far too sweet. This should be a firm and flaky type of fish. I usually catch, clean and cook my own. This piece of fish was mushy and had no flavor. I took 3 bites and did not eat the rest THANK GOD. This was the only meal I had eaten yesterday. At about noon today I had the worst stomach cramps and issues that I don't want to get into detail over - food poisoning. I called to speak to the manager and she was conveniently "on the phone with a customer" the lady who answered the phone did not offer to take my number for her to call me back.  Do not eat the fish here guys- it's not worth trying to work and run to the bathroom every 20 minutes.   Needless to say I will not be returning and I will be letting everyone I know about how sick this food made me.
Wow!!!  What an experience!  I'm not even joking when I say this is the best seafood restaurant in the Phoenix metro area! Jessica's service was professional, friendly, and extremely detailed.
Pretty good, not so sure on how fresh the oysters were. Service was good, food not bad for a mall restaurant

My daughter and I had a late lunch, I had the King's combo platter and she had the macadamia crusted halibut.  The fish on my platter was soggy and soaking with grease and the scallops were a little chewy. The physical place and the wait staff were excellent, but the food not so much.  They ended up comping my platter, which I very much appreciated.  We both had stomach cramps afterward and the prices are very high.  Our server was Jessica who was excellent.

Can a restaurant get worse and worse every year and still remain open?  I guess so....kings is terrible and huge and gorgeous......I only went there to meet a client halfway.  In the failed Tempe marketplace, where even the Levi store cannot make it sits Kings....an overpriced horrible restaurant that was empty for lunch last Saturday. I would have had better food at jack in the box.  My tacos, which I did complain about, were disgusting....they even messed up the cilantro...which takes effort. You are supposed to use the leaves only...not the stems, the stems are inedible.  I was pulling them out from each bite. Very gracefulI , I was told they were purposely placed there to make a rustic taco....so I guess I can serve a pile of crap and call it rustic? No salsa and stale chips were the perfect accompaniment.... My husband ordered a shrimp salad. The lettuce was old and brown. No one could be bothered to toss it, it had the look of a thrown in handful of each stale ingredient with a tiny amount of shrimp. You could almost see the plastic gloves and the bored underpaid kitchen staff...( wanna bet? ) stay away unless you like bread for dinner. By some miracle the bread is still edible. Please do not believe any good reviews you see here...it is simply impossible that this restaurant transforms into anything but what I saw...a lowly corporate effort........very overpriced.....I would be shocked if they make it year.

I came here for the first time the other night and was very impressed! I had the blackened swordfish with grilled zucchini and northwest vegetables. The swordfish was seasoned with cajun spices and came with a side of dipping sauce (have no idea what it was but it was delish!)  The zucchini was grilled perfectly and the northwest vegetables were glazed carrots, snap peas and string onions. Our waitress was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed throughout our dinner.  Will definitely be coming back here!

Went there for a company outing and we found out that the appetizers are better than the main dish...  The Mediterranean dish was good enough...  The waiter was very friendly and helpful when deciding what to order since it was the first time there...

I had lunch here and enjoyed it very much.  The menu is very diverse and loaded with good fish and other seafood.  The atmosphere was nice and the service was quick...although a little over attentive.  I will definitely try dinner her.

I was very disappointed with our dinner here last evening. Starting with freezer burned bread that was terrible. Our food was tasteless and the worst part was the small flies buzzing around our heads and food. When I mentioned it to our waitress (who was very nice) she acted like it was normal for them to be there. No apologies or can I move you - nothing. There was literally a swarm you could see! Mahi Mahi & Swordfish was over cooked and dry, trout was tasteless. When several flies flew into our wine glasses and we didn't want  to drink them, I complain to the waitress again, who said oh I'm sorry let me get you another one. She literally brought back less wine in the glass than what we lost - guess they didn't want to spoil us.;( Prices reflect expectations of better food and definitely no bugs. Next Call is to health Dept as that can't be acceptable!   Update: I received a call from the General Manager of this Restaurant who actually read my review and called me to apologize. She said they used my feedback in their training seminar to ensure this would never happen again. I must say, I was impressed with her sincerity and willingness to improve their service.  Thus I've adjusted my review because it's not how you fall - but how you get up!  Thank you for caring. I'll be back.

Delicious meal for a party of six. The food was well cooked and feesh. The drinks were great and service impeccable.  Our server was attentive and friendly  throughout.  Food was served in a timely manner.  The cost was such a bargain, we will certainly be back!

I ordered a seaweed salad.  The portion was approximately 2.5oz.  It was good, but it was too small.  I also ordered the cold seafood platter.  It was good, but when I spend $45 on lunch, I don't expect to have to devein my shrimp.  The Bloody Mary was great, so that bumped the score to two stars.
Great lunch, decent prices, great service, really fresh seafood, perfect ambiance! Definitely coming back!
Food and server Barclay was the best! Recommend the Louie Salad w crab and shrimp. We have been here about 20 times and everything is always pitch perfect!

This is the first time my husband and I ate inside the restaurant.  The last two times my husband ordered takeout.  We usually order the fish and chips.  My only complaint is the fish is soggy by the time he gets home.  We live about 12 miles away.  So we decided to see if it would still be soggy if we ate there.  Unfortunately it was still soggy but still very good.  We will probably go back and order another 2.5 lbs lobster.  That was yummy!

This King's trip was a birthday dinner for me.  We had never been, reviews were ok and the menu enticing.  So last night we made a reservation for 630. Upon arrival, it is confusing because the entrance is on the north, when parking is behind. So then we went in the wrong door, into the Oyster Bar, not seeing a clear entrance. The hostess was fantastic, and we were seated right away. Our server Steven came to take the drink order promptly, but did not return promptly. I sat there for a good 20 minutes with a super hard chunk of cold bread with warm butter...and no drink. Our drinks were dropped, but we were not asked if we were ready to order or if we had any questions in the menu. And we wait. My pina colada was not well blended and quickly looked like the crushed ice at the bottom of your big gulp after the beverage is gone. Should have just gotten a beer or something else. Our orders are taken. And we wait. The cold platter arrives, which has an ample sampling of shrimp, crab and oysters with the accoutrements. The oysters were fresh and sweet. Horseradish freshly ground. I can't compare the oysters, since I've never had an oyster before. The shrimp were large and also fresh. I was not exactly elated at having to dig the intestinal tract out of most of my shrimp. I wasn't expecting to devein before I eat at a restaurant. The crab was not served with a cracker, so we tried our best on the thinner shelled legs. When we finally see Steven later, we ask for a cracker. And we wait. We finally finish in time for the entrees to arrive with perfect timing. I have the crab cakes with asparagus. Both are tasty and are cooked well. My husband ordered the N'Awlins BBQ shrimp. The sauce was hot but not very flavorful. At least those shrimp had been deveined! There was a random piece of lemon mixed in, and my husband, thinking it a pepper or something, got a big sour surprise! The entrees went well overall. And we wait. The hostess clears our table and my husband has been waiting for another beer for.ever. Steven returns and says "Are you all set and done or did you want dessert?". Maybe I'm crazy, but I found it a bit brash. It's not like I'm getting a free meal and someone told you I'm a crappy tipper (I'm an excellent topper, btw...I was a server once). Dessert (yes I want it! It's my birthday!) was Strawberry Shortcake, but only since they were out of Creme Brulee. Who runs out on Thursday?? Boo. The shortcake was cold, dry and hard. Not impressed.  It is not likely that we will return to King's Fish House.

Korey was an awesome bartender. He was so friendly, fun and knowledgeable. Food was great, try the shrimp taquitos. Can't wait to go back for the fresh lobsters and oyster bar. They also have a great assortment of cocktails!

My husband and I have driven by this restaurant so many times and never went in until last week. We wanted to give it a try since it is near a lot of our other favorite restaurants in Tempe Marketplace.  When we walked in on a Saturday night it was not too busy which surprised us a little. We did notice they have a private dining room. And that was not in use. I would say it was about 60% at occupancy.  The patios were totally empty but it is still 100 degrees or warmer still.  We were given a large booth that was way too big for just two of us so we asked for something smaller. We were approached fairly quickly. Our drink orders were taken and for me drinking water it was not easy to get refills as much as I wanted. That was the only bad thing about the meal.  We got lots of bread and butter. That was nice. I ordered the Fish and Chips and they good. Not great, not terrible. Nothing new and exciting. The fish was great underneath the breading. It was a bit mushy and next time I would order it crispy. My husband had the cajun dish which he liked and had lots of flavor.  The ambiance was nice. Service was goof. Some food things could have been better. If you like fish try this place.

I was rather disappointed with the prices and services given the reviews. The food was good but nothing to write home about. The fish was dry and our Mac n cheese was cold.  When we ordered our final rounds, the wait time was excessive. To compensate, they offered a free desert. We were informed after the fact about price changes for our cocktails which were outrageous. We had double shot beverages and were informed after our bills came that we would be charged for separate shots which cost more than the drink itself. Considering you couldn't taste the liquor this was rather upsetting. The manager put blame on the waitress for not telling us ahead of time. Poor thing didn't see that bus coming.

our family stopped in at 8pm on february 10th.  there was no wait and a few folks eating in the restaurant.  we were sat very quickly.  our server, cody, was awesome.  we ordered coconut crusted wild ecuadorian mahi mahi, wild baja californian yellowtail, wild alaskan red king crab and southwest salad.  we loved all our meals!  we did not have any problems with our order.  our meal for 2 adults and 1 child was around $41.  the restaurant is very nice inside but it was disturbing to see so few people inside.  so we had a great quiet dinner.  for the record parking and traffic sucks real bad at this restaurant location in the tempe market place.

We were fans of the Fish House in San Diego, so we were thrilled when we found this one while visiting Tempe!   Amanda was the best bartender/waitress.  She was interesting and made our dining experience even better!  Definitely recommend this place.  Ask for Ananda!

I don't eat seafood much, and never before at a fancier, seafood-specific place like this. Although our waiter was friendly and generally on top of it, I was pretty disappointed by the food. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt that the fish is fresher than I could get elsewhere (though I couldn't really tell), but the portions didn't match the price, and the fish was poorly seasoned. That being said, the sides I got (mac and cheese, grilled zucchini) were deeeelicious.

Gonna Have To Do 3 Stars.     After earning our meal by doing a few miles of fast paced hiking over at Papago Park earlier in the evening, my wife & I decided to check out King's which, for some reason neither of us can remember, we both already had bookmarked on Yelp.  We were in the mood for seafood and had some cod at home ready to be prepared, but decided we were hangry enough to just jet over to King's to spend what ended up being $150 for a mediocre dinner.  While we always enjoy each other's company when out and about, kind of wish we had just gone home.    Started with the Oysters Rockefeller, which was tasty.   Everybody seems to do Rockefeller differently, and King's prepares it with what I think is sort of Hollandaise sauce on top.  I liked it.    I then had the King's Spicy Seafood Chowder which was awesome and hearty.  One could do a bowl of that and a salad and call it a meal, honestly.  Very good.    I then had the "Fish House Favorite" Macadamia Nut Encrusted Alaskan Halibut.  It was done nicely, and was a truly ample portion of Halibut.   But there was no evidence of an "orange ginger butter sauce" and I'm not really sure how to describe the flavor other than just sort of "blah".   Not impressive, especially at $31.  On the other hand, the dish came with two sides, so I had garlic mashed potatoes and mac&cheese.  These sides were both delicious - they do a really nice job with these two sides and the portions of both were also ample.    I try to keep Yelp reviews limited to my food / my experience and not that of other people in my party, however, I have to factor my wife's experience into this one.   She ordered the Filet Mignon (med-rare) and South African Lobster Tail combo.   Her lobster tail was huge and delicious, but her filet was overcooked and I think it was a bad cut of meat in general as it was extremely dry even though it looked like it was a solid medium in the middle.  Per the restaurant policy, they "unconditionally guarantee their product", so upon pointing out that the steak was overdone, our server immediately offered to have a fresh cut prepared.    It was better, med-rare in the middle but still overdone closer to the edges -- but at least much more juicy throughout than the first cut.   To her further chagrin, she also found that her large baked potato was raw in the middle.  She did not send it back or mention it because by this time we were basically done with our meal.   I had a single beer from one of my favorite breweries -- North Coast Brewing Scrimshaw Pilsner -- something that's not common here in the valley, and she had a glass of the Nielsen Pinot.   So, the good -- Oysters, the chowder, my sides, her lobster, our drinks. The not so good -- my entree, her filet, part of her side, and the cost of our all-told mediocre meal.

Last night my husband and I came in and we had a waitress named Teresa, she was the best server we have ever had. From the moment she came to our table she lit up the room with her smile and made our experience there personal. From the fish and chips to her warm welcoming personality, our experience was 110% excellent.  Even if the food wasn't good, I would go back just to have Teresa serve me again. She was absolutely amazing

My wife and I went here a while back and wont go again! She had a burger that was OK. I was the one that had all the problem! I ordered the fish with the side of mac. and the oyster sampler. The oysters were good but way over priced for the 8. My food got there at last and the fish was around a 3 oz portion which the waitress pointed out that I had a bigger portion coming! Why the hell would they even send it out if it wasn't right? I at my two bites of fish and while I was waiting for the rest of my missing fish I try ed the mac. I was old and dried out. I sent it and they brought me another portion that was nearly as bad. By this time my wife was finished with her food and I still waited.I finely got the attention of one of the wait staff (I hadn't seen my waitress for a while) and asked when the rest of my fish was coming? No one knew what I was yalking about. They hunted down my waitress, the girl who brought me the skimpy order and the manager. By the time it was all straightened out we were ready to leave. They comped the fish but for the burger and the oysters and a couple of beers the bill was still over fifty! I wont be back!   I have to now give praise to the Fish House! I first posted my thoughts on a food blog and never had a response. Once I posted on Yelp I received several e-mails all from different individuals voicing their concern about my experience at Kings! I have to say that my opinion has changed drastically about this establishment! If I get a response of concern like this from just my complaint I feel that they really do care about everything related to their establishment and have to give them cu dos and high marks! I will continue.....

I am giving King's Fish House three stars on customer service and that is about it. After my last review on our poor experience on Mother's Day I was contacted by the manager Kari. She was very nice to have offered to correct the situation and to give King's the chance to correct the problems that we experienced on our last visit.  We arrived tonight around 5:45pm. We were promptly seated and our server arrived within minutes of us being seated. She was very nice and attentive. I asked her how the mojitos were and she suggested that I get one. Unfortunately I would have to say the mojito was probably the best item of the night. My fiancé ordered the filet cooked medium and I ordered the King's combo (fried shrimp, fish and scallops). The shrimp were pretty good, the fish was okay and the scallops were just the same as the last time I reported, gritty. My fiancé's steak was severely under seasoned and had no flavor at all. He also got a baked potato which instead of being overcooked (previous visit) it was cold in the middle. I got coleslaw and corn as sides. The corn was good but the coleslaw had no flavor at all. For the prices that are charged at this restaurant I cannot believe the quality of food.  I am sorry to say that I will not ever be back here. Thank you Kari for the opportunity to make things right but unfortunately I think the quality of food is out of your hands.

Sometime I wonder what happened to Bennigans...and now I know: it's come back as King's Fish House.  And in case you aren't getting the profuse, dripping sarcasm, that's no compliment.   More expensive, far more pretentious, so average yet aims so high.  My food was very, very average. Best thing was the grilled asparagus but balsamic and Parmesan is something I can do myself. Fish was blah. Really. While I certainly didn't ask anyone to taste my fish, I'm telling you, no one you or I know would have sampled my fish and exclaimed, "God, this is good!" because it wasn't. It was BLAND. No smoke flavor, no benefit from plank-cooking. Really, the problem was:                       NO FLAVOR.   And they're not giving anything away. Let me put it to you this way: as I was walking out I passed a 12-top, 12 folks chomping away at a variety of seafood, and all I could think of was the guy who signs that check for $900 is not going home happy. It's a friggin' Bennigans and now it's a $1000 bucks.  Oh, and one more thing: maybe could you let the staff at King's Fish House know:  per State Law: you are not once allowed to touch face/hair/each other while serving food?  Good Lord!  How do you get a foodhandlers card in Maricopa County and not know this?  Hmmm.  Somehow King's Fish House employees missed these memos. Sheesh. Or worse. Its disgusting and I saw at least half a dozen crewmembers ignore this strict food policy.   HAND CONTAMINATION  IS THE MOST COMMON CAUSE OF  FOOD-BORNE ILLNESS. Fact.   IF YOU TOUCH YOUR FACE OR HAIR YOU MUST WASH     Slow Service.  There wasn't one thing, not one instance I encountered in my visit that could've been defined as "prompt". Doesn't the word "tip", stand for "to insure promptness"? Kinda does.   And one more thing, (again): fix your website. I hit "contact us" and got the recipe page. I hit the recipe page link and got recipes. The prices on the menu were not at all current.  IN OTHER WORDS, WHY ISN'T ANYONE AT BENNIGANS, errrrr, KING'S FISH HOUSE -- paying attention to your website?  And one more thing: do ya just take any image, of anyone, anything, put a frame around it, and hang it in the wall?  Is that interior decorating nowadays?  Because they've got stuff on the wall that is so random, so arbitrary, so busy, so nothing-to-do-with-fish, it's not so much "odd"as it is just so ordinary. No one, not even King's Fish House, aspires to ordinary.   So average. Slow service. Buy somebody else's Groupon...or just go around the corner to Portillos. This place blows.

I love writing a review on seafood-specialty restaurants.  I am deathly allergic to shellfish, so I'm impressed when the staff takes note and ensures that my meal will not result in a call for paramedics.  (Please note - I take the risk because I can eat fish - just not shellfish.)   Our department held their holiday lunch here - great day for patio seating (heaters and wind shields in place made it bright, cheery and comfortable).  GREAT place for a group of 40.   They had set up a special menu for us with 4 soup/salads, 4 entrees and 2 dessert options.  I ordered the Caesar salad, blackened tilapia, and apple cobbler.  I loved that our server checked to make sure that I was good with anchovies in the salad dressing, and ensured me that my food would be prepared in a way not to cross-contaminate with the shrimp orders.   The warm loaves of bread were a big hit with the group.  Those who opted for the seafood chowder and clam chowder really seemed to enjoy them. My meal was perfect - a generous order of fish, seasoned perfectly; grilled zucchini slices and creamy potatoes.  I ate every bite.  My cobbler had the right amount of ice cream.   Great service, good food, and great location.

I contemplated writing this review for a VERY long time. My last review was a bit scathing, however the manager asked me about my experience and so I decided to give it another go.  Pros: Good service, great bread, AMAZING oysters  My family shared Fanny Bay oysters and they were absolutely wonderful and plated beautifully. The mignonette was also amazing and had a very nuanced flavor. If I come back, it will be for these oysters.   After our appetizers things started to go down hill a little bit. To sum up all our dishes- every fish dish was overcooked. Fish is a delicate protein and should be cooked that way. It shouldn't have a texture that resembles chalk. Besides the fish, everything was quite nice (the sides were tasty). For around $20-$25 dollars per plate, it is not worth it. Portions are also small but it wouldn't have mattered if the food was good-which it wasn't.  The manager obviously cares for this restaurant a lot, unfortunately the chef does not. The seafood is obviously of great quality, and it is truly unfortunate that they have been destroyed by not being cooked correctly. I would only recommend this place perhaps for lunch or if you just want to get some drinks with friends because the bread, service, and oysters were well worth the price tag. Don't come here for anything that is cooked.

The service is great but the food was bland and nothing special. The prices were okay and the portions big enough that I had some leftovers for lunch the next day. Had high hopes due to the location and limited seafood options around the city but one trip was enough for me.

It is definitely time to update my review.  The hubs and I decided to give Kings Fish House another try after having a mediocre previous experience and I'm so glad we did! Not only was this visit better than the last, but it exceeded our expectations.  It started off with Timber, our server, who was exceptional.  She was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and was willing to explain anything we needed to know, always with a smile on her face.  When she asked if we would like a salad before our meal, she could see us contemplating and suggested that we share a salad...perfect! She also brought it out on two separate plates so that we didn't have to do it ourselves.  Timber kept our glasses filled during the entire meal and was attentive but not overbearing.  She was great!  The manager, Patrick, also visited our table to make sure that we were enjoying ourselves and had everything we needed.  The staff at this location was excellent and it is obvious that they care about their guests.  On to the food...we started off with the sourdough bread.  It came out warm and was fresh and delicious.  We then split a caesar salad.  Again, fresh and yummy.  Then, the entrees came.  We both ordered the blackened salmon.  I opted for grilled zucchini and glazed carrots for my sides while the hubs asked for the buttered corn.  OMG...we love to smoke our salmon at home but we both agreed that this was by far the best salmon we've ever had at a restaurant.  It was that good! In addition, the sides were just as enjoyable.  Super flavorful and cooked just right.    I'm so glad we didn't give up on Kings Fish House.  This visit was amazing and we will definitely be returning for some more of that salmon!

Eaten at their location in long-beach, CA on many occasions this location I would say to be slightly better I like the blue cheese candied walnut salad (on a diet) the shrimp cocktail was excellent (ok I was a little bad with my diet) I had to have the key lime pie (it's tart, but oh so sweet!)

King's Fish House is a chain restaurant.  Not as big as McCormick & Schmick's.  They have locations in CA, NV, and AZ for now.  It's located in the Tempe Marketplace which is always super busy but that's not a problem.  Actually the first time we went to King's Fish House, we liked it so much we decided to come back again the next day!  The seafood here is GREAT!  It's so hard to find a place for good seafood.  I actually prefer King's Fish House more than McCormick & Schmick's!  They have something for everyone even if you're not in to seafood.  But if you are they even have sandwiches, sushi, oyster platters, and pasta.  I learned from my first time here that their portion sizes are pretty big, so when we came back a second time we shared one of the plates haha.  Well we shared our sides, we each got our own plates.  Also the calamari is a good choice for appetizers!    The restaurant overall is not too bad.  We came here in a group of 8 and they easily accommodated us last minute.   And our server was on top of everything with orders, drinks, knowing who got what.  Great customer service!  Also they sometimes have good deals where you buy their giftcard and a bonus gift card.

We have dined at King's Fish House in Southern California, have had  good experiences there, so, thought we would try it in Tempe with some friends.  Boy we were disappointed with the entire dining experience! ...  with the exception of the sourdough bread. The Server that asked for our drinks was dull, & when asked how late they were open, was happy her shift would be over soon  --  the Server who brought our food - seemed bothered that she had to wait on her customers, no smiles anywhere & when we asked questions about the menu the answers were short & curt. The wild shrimp was not fresh,  sauteed spinach too much garlic.  When asked our friends how their meals were one said he enjoyed the trout almondine, others were so, so - disappointed the scallops were small - which our Server told us was because they were not in season.  We had to flag a server down to ask for something  - seems all held their heads up in the sky instead of looking around for their customers inquiries or needs.  When we inquired about  the salted caramel ice cream for dessert, we were informed that it is only available in the summer and had to coax our Server to tell us what else was available, again she seemed very bothered. We will not be back - not any of us, will visit this place only on our trips to Southern California. Perhaps they should have the Employees in Calif. train the Servers & Chefs in Tempe.
I am really not a fish person, in fact I never eat it. But, Cassie was super patient and helped me figure out what I was going to be able to handle and I was actually very satisfied with the salmon!

I was meeting two of my employees to have a lunch meeting, and this place was recommended by a colleague.  Anyways as soon as I walk in I got ignore, I have to ask if I needed to seat my self then she said "oh you are waiting" (with bad attitude) I almost say no I just here for decoration, duh of course I was waiting. So she took my name down, less than one minute after few people walk in and she greet them with a smile and ask of two or more, so they got a table.  We got our table, thing change here our server was nice, attentive and give us recommendations.  The 3 starts is for the first people when you walk in, customer service needs to improve or I do I need to change the color on my skin.  God we are in 2014!!  Our server was nice, food was good.
Service was great and the food was awesome! Thanks for making our Father's Day awesome with a perfect lobster dinner. Props to our server Raeshel!!!

I wanted to like this place so bad as I love seafood and want a wider selection of restaurants to go to that serve good seafood. After a bad experience in their Carlsbad location, our family decided to give the Tempe location a try on a Saturday night. One star is for our reservation on Opentable because we were seated upon arrival. The second star is for our server. Now comes the food--- my 4 yr old loves calamari so we always order it. The Tempe location does have better Calamari than the Carlsbad location. We also ordered a bowl of clam chowder, popcorn shrimp for my son and my husband ordered the scallops and shrimp platter. Everything we ordered was much better than our previous experience at their Carlsbad location. However, the portions suck!!! The clam chowder should be called bacon soup as it had more bacon than anything else. But then again, that's what probably made the chowder good. The popcorn shrimp was good. There were plenty of tiny shrimp for a 4 year old to eat.. But considering it was served on a huge platter, the cook could have at least filled it with more fries. Like seriously there were probably 25pcs of tiny overcooked fries on that plate. Now comes the scallops and shrimp with a side of zucchini. Unfortunately my phone's battery died before I could take a photo of my husband's plate. But let's just say for $25 for his order, we could have eaten somewhere much MUCH better. His huge platter came with 3 tiny scallops. Not exactly bay scallops but definitely NOT quality ones either. 5 pieces of small shrimps and 3 pieces of overcooked zucchini. Seriously, we've had more veggies than that at a fine dining restaurant. Our bill was $70- something.. We don't usually mind paying for good food but this time we felt like we wasted our money. Sorry King's fish. We will never go back.

Wife and I stopped off at this restaurant for our date night.  The Last time we were there, I asked Michelle, the general manager, when they would have dungeness crab. She said to drop her an email and she would let us know. In mid April I received an email describing the two crab dishes.  Tonight we both both ordered the steam dungeness crab which comes with 2 sides. Started off by splitting a Cesar Salad. The romaine lettuce was cold and crisp with some type of anchovie  dressing.
